Author: votecoin.site
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: Hi, VoteCoin is still waiting for import/export support for viewing keys. We need that to be able to switch all polls/campaigns from sprout format (old slow secure payments) to sapling format (new fast secure payments) There is nobody in VoteCoin team who would have balls to code that part ourselves, so we're waiting for ZCash to officially support it so we can backport it into VoteCoin. Apparently this takes much longer than expected, so unfortunately there is no ETA known yet -Tom

Author: votecoin.site
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: New version of VoteCoin 2.0.4 is released  we are happy to announce that VoteCoin 2.0.4 is released, and both CLI and GUI wallets were updated. Most noticeable change is optimization in GUI wallet for faster sync and better performance. Since the previous version of VoteCoin wallet has been already deprecated, it is essentially required to update to the new version  GUI wallet download: https://github.com/Tomas-M/VoteCoin-wallet/releases CLI wallet download: https://github.com/Tomas-M/VoteCoin/releases  For your information, there is already an implementation in progress for import/export viewing keys (ivk) which are needed for switching the voting to sapling (for faster poll publishing). So next version of VoteCoin will most likely switch to Sapling even for its voting features (sapling is already supported in VoteCoin but only for sending/receiving fast shielded transactions)  Enjoy! :]

Author: TeamCyr
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: Thank you Tom.  Any chance you would work on the algo change? I understand that makes it difficult to keep updating with ZEC but I think its definitely worth considering 144.5 or 192.5 algo developed originally by the BTCz team.  Currently the entire VOTE network produces 71,280 coins worth only $35 for and entire 24 hour day. The global hashrate is equivalent to only eight A9 miners. The result is a pure mine-n-dump and eventually the blockchain will fall apart. I'm sorry you don't see how ASICs can ruin your project. ASIC owners are in a whole from day 1. They have hardware that depreciates 3x faster than GPUs. ASICS have practically no resale value about 10% in one year. GPUs are worth 60% after one year of mining. ASIC owners have no choice but to mine-n-dump to break even for their A9 bricks.  Would you be interested in passing on the task to another developer who may have more time to improve upon your work?

Author: votecoin.site
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: Regarding Sapling upgrade, it was a necessary step towards faster and less memory-hungry shielded transactions. Before sapling, every shielded transaction used more than 1GB of RAM and it took several minutes to complete. Due to that, creating polls/votings through VoteCoin took long time and lots of resources, since the polls are technically stored on blockchain as a shielded transactions. Now after Sapling, only about 50MB of RAM is needed to create a shielded transaction, and it only takes few seconds to compute. Sapling shielded addresses are now default in VoteCoin (since 2.0.2), it works if you want to send a transaction to somebody else, but polls are still using old pre-sapling mechanism (called sprout) and it is still neither optimal nor fast.  So, our next goal is to switch to Sapling for polls too in VoteCoin as well. But this requires support for exporting of viewing keys from the wallet for sapling addresses, which is not yet supported by VoteCoin. Since VoteCoin is a fork of zcash, we decided to wait for ZCash to implement it, and then we can backport it easily. Anybody in VoteCoin team does not feel comfortable trying to implement this feature on our own at the moment, since making a mistake would have fatal consequences, so it's safer to wait for official support in ZCash.  Regarding portable wallet, the current GUI wallet can be safely used from an USB device on Windows, since it stores data within the wallet directory. However this is not possible on MAC, since MAC stores wallet data on local user's home directory, regardless of where was the wallet application started from.  -Tom

Author: votecoin.site
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: IMPORTANT: Zcash Counterfeiting Vulnerability Successfully Remediated original post: https://z.cash/blog/zcash-counterfeiting-vulnerability-successfully-remediated/  VoteCoin is based on zcash, so it had the same vulnerability in its code as well.  Since VoteCoin is following zcash development closely and our team is backporting all news and improvements from zcash, especially the Sapling upgrade, the vulnerability has been fixed in the same manner as it was in ZCash, on the same day when ZCash fixed it (by activating Sapling upgrade in VoteCoin network on 28th of October, 2018).  We have found no evidence that the vulnerability was discovered by anyone else or that counterfeiting occurred.  It is possible to verify the total amounts of coins held in sprout addresses (i.e., the Sprout shielded pool) in the output of following command: Code: votecoin-cli getblockchaininfo As long as the value in the shielded pools are greater than zero, no counterfeiting has been detected.  -Tom

Body: No news is great news This is just for information, there are currently no news in VoteCoin, since we are waiting for implementation of z_exportViewingKey RPC call in the zcash core. As soon as this is implemented, we will backport it to VoteCoin and continue our work to switch all polls to the new sapling format. As of our understanding, z_exportViewingKey is not yet supported in zcash 2.0.2 so it may be few more months before this happens. -Tom

"I can see, they requested $300 for that  I just wrote them an email we're not going to pay for that, upgrading the wallet is a 5 minute work  If digitalprice is not going to update the wallet, they should at least give users the private keys for their wallet addresses - so a person can safely import his deposit to his wallet back (and send it to a new address himself)"  Dev obviously realizes they are a business and have a bottom line and vot is a super low volume coin. But tradesatoshi and cratex exchanges updated without asking for anything. He is looking for community Input. Post thoughts in chat channels.  Thanks everyone.

Author: votecoin.site
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: Releasing new version of VoteCoin (both CLI and GUI wallets) v2.0.2 Since this release, sapling addresses are used by default (voting still uses sprout main address though) Notable changes:  - Add Sapling support to RPC z_mergetoaddress - Mitigate transaction expiry height related DoS vector - Return Sapling addresses by default when calling RPC z_getnewaddress - Add Sapling spend and output description benchmarks to RPC zcbenchmark - Fix bug with Sapling chain value tracking - Fix encoding bug with non-ASCII parameter paths, primarily affecting Windows - Backport from upstream the relaying of blocks when pruning - Don’t ban peers when loading pre-Sapling blocks during syncing - Fix bug with contents of default memo in Sapling  Download VoteCoin from github:  CLI (text mode node server): https://github.com/Tomas-M/VoteCoin/releases  GUI (wallet application): https://github.com/Tomas-M/VoteCoin-wallet/releases

Body: What do you exactly mean by "initiating the vot.wallet"? VoteCoin stores addersses in wallet.dat file. If this file is missing, VoteCoin assumes you want to create new wallet, so it creates new addresses for you.

Author: votecoin.site
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: What console tool do you mean? I am not sure. There is already a console tool for VoteCoin, it is votecoin-cli (it is part of the VoteCoin CLI release, see https://github.com/Tomas-M/VoteCoin/releases) It communicates with your running node (you need to be running either the CLI version of votecoind, or you can be running the GUI wallet) On windows, you need to put votecoin-cli.exe to the same directory as votecond.exe within the \resourses\app\ directory. On MAC, you should be fine running it from whatever directory. -Tom

Author: votecoin.site
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: Hello, VoteCoin is based on ZCash, and for that reason it is somehow resource-heavy when using secure transactions. So implementing VoteCoin to your android wallet is currently not a good idea. This all will change with Sapling, which will activate in a week, but I guess it will be still problematic as long as we support old Sprout transactions. So at the moment I would suggest you to NOT implement any zcash-based coin to your wallet yet. -Tom

Author: votecoin.site
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: Announcement As it has been already mentioned, the official VoteCoin pool is no longer running. We had plans to put it down long time ago, and the fault which occured last week made us finally do that. Please request your unpaid rewards by email (send mail to info@votecoin.site).  We are happy to see that binance added VoteCoin to their INFO portal. Our focus is now on backporting all Sapling features from Zcash core, so VoteCoin can benefit from faster shielded transactions as well.  -Tom

Author: votecoin.site
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: New version of VoteCoin CLI Wallet (2.0.1) has been released.  This release is the second Sapling-compatible version of the VoteCoin node software. The first block of Sapling will be block 245555. Please test and report any issues.  Download here: https://github.com/Tomas-M/VoteCoin/releases/  Notable Changes in this release: Sapling RPC Support Hierarchical Deterministic Key Generation Fix Signing Raw Transactions with Unsynced Offline Nodes  For complete summary of changes check ZCash blog

Author: votecoin.site

Body: The only way to get your coins is to recover your wallet.dat file, or to get private keys for your addresses (which are stored in your wallet.dat file). It is not technically possible to access your coins in any other way, sadly.  Another possibility is to purchase 25000 VOT on tradesatoshi for current exchange rate ($140 in total), which is not that much -Tom

Author: TheSea
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: Think and choose the right version of events  Perhaps the developer chose the wrong strategy. Informational emptiness is not the best way to increase interest in the project. The official pool often falls, I see the negative balances of the miners and do not see any comments from the author about this, although earlier he always reported on the failures and quickly corrected them. If the sports betting system is improved, success will raise this project to new heights. Why create obstacles to success with your own hands? Perhaps the author helps those who want to buy coins at the lowest price? This is the usual method of attracting large investors without increasing the coin rate ..  When the etherium was young the price fell down, the sponsors were constantly added, the price continued to fall, the miners complained about the low price. Vitalik said that the etherium should not be expensive. Of course, in fact it was the moment of buying coins by investors at a low price. Those who realized this were happy after a while.

Also its kinda of a false equivalence to suggest vot isnt succesful, look the wider market, you could argue most coins arent doing well, but VOT is a survivor and dev has been updating wallet and been commiting on github this whole time, that to me is a mark of success the ones who grind through the tough times.  Once the roadmap changes are implimented ill do an updated video, im in this for atleast 3 years so i wont judge until then but if you were in the short term profit game vot has been to 600sats and then another spike so hopefully you capitalized then!

Author: thesudio
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: [/quote]   Tom,  now, we are afraid, if you told us you don't have any future plan for VOTECOIN, specially when you write in the white paper:  - We assume that VoteCoin will achieve at least similar or even better results and the past statistics support our assumption.  You want to do the same or better results of coin listed in few exchanges, just in tradesatoshi? You will never, never se the coin growth there.  Peoples invest thousands dollars in this project, if you don't have any marketing strategy I suggest you to do one for the next months. [/quote]   This is a community coin, the ICO stated all ICO funds will go directly to wallet functionality and vision, Yes tom is a very technical dev, he hired graphic design devs for the gui wallet to look the way it does, he has said marketing and paying for listings wont come before private txs, shielded addresses, private betting, auto refunds, poll reviews and poll explorer spruce up, then after that theres mobile wallet, crowdfunding protocol etc etc and even then vot may not succeed and the funds left for marketing might be dry but hey im excited and will hodl for atleast a few years. Its the community that builds up the crypto, if enough of us contact youtubers (when the wallet is updated for shileded addys and the proper sapling update) and contact bloggers and crypto news sites, if those people can see vot is being used in terms of www.betvot.com and poll explorer they will be keen to talk about it.   But theres still so much to do before Votecoin can be pitched to the bigger youtubers etc and most of that has to do with community use, if we can market vot amongst ourselves and bring in some noobs to partake in getting the volume up not only on tradesatoshi but the other exchanges vot is on like digitalprice and cratex. The wallet and the tech and the proposition is sound, i agree not marketing can seem like shooting yourself in the foot, but getting the wrong people to market it or marketing a product thats not 100% can also shoot you in the foot, but i agree it shouldnt be for a lack of trying.

Maybe they are already  doing so as all the Equihash based coins are falling since Feb in BTC value but again that is not proven so hopefully it is not true . Author: votecoin.site
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: Warning There seems to be a problem with sending shielded transactions (including creating polls) on newer VoteCoin versions (since 1.1.1) on Windows. We are aware of the issue and we will release fixed version as soon as it is available and thoroughly tested. It has something to do with the new windows build system (introduced in zcash-core 1.1.0). We are sorry for the inconvenience, please be patient since the fix may take few weeks to be fully functional.

Author: votecoin.site
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: New release: VoteCoin 1.1.2 including GUI Wallet  We are happy to announce new version of VoteCoin 1.1.2 including GUI wallet for Windows, Mac and Linux. This release adds minor improvements to the GUI wallet, user now has access to the debug log messages on startup, and through settings. Most importantly, this release should fix problems with sending shielded payments and publishing polls. Download new release at https://github.com/Tomas-M/VoteCoin-wallet/releases  FYI: This release contains VoteCoin 1.1.2.1 core.

Author: votecoin.site
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: It is currently not possible to export/import private keys for shielded addresses. The reason is that the underlaying Zcash core has a bug (as far as I know) and coins from imported shielded priv keys are unspendable. Because of that, we decided to offer only export/import for transparent addresses. I hope the 2.0 release fixes these issues. -Tom

Author: votecoin.site
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: We are actually considering several possibilities regarding Android wallet, I think the best is to wait for VoteCoin 2.0 (which adds sapling support from zcash) and then reconsider available options again, because this update will bring significant changes (support for sending fast shielded payments) and we need those for polls. I didn't review Bitpay wallet forked by BTCz team, but I guess they support only transparent addresses, right? I doubt that shielded transactions can be made on mobile devices with slow CPU and low RAM. -Tom

Author: egyptianbman
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: The reason why the pool is showing profit while the wallet isn't is because the pool likely hasn't applied the most recent update. Unfortunately, most pool owners aren't able to watch the ANN threads of all the coins on their pool. I would consider this update while major, very silently rolled out. I wasn't made aware of this update until someone reported the exact issue to me that you're reporting. This update has caused a fork that some pools are still mining on.  With that being said, https://equipool.1ds.us is updated on all three stratums (North America, Europe and Asia) and blocks are being found again. You're welcome to join us!

Author: thesudio
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: Hi Everyone, Since there are some people still asking i thought ill post this again.  Here are some guides on how to update to the new Wallet after overwinter update.  If you are updating from GUI walet 1. (optional step) Open old wallet, will automatically open in safe mode and wait to sync. 2. Make a backup of old wallet esp wallet.dat (votecoin folder/resources/app/votecoin) 3. Download new wallet (Dont start wallet) https://github.com/Tomas-M/VoteCoin-wallet/releases/ and copy all the files from new wallet into the old wallet and overwrite all files (170 files) 4. Wallet.dat file should still be in there unaffected 5. Open votecoin.exe after files were overwritten 6. Wait to sync.  If you are updating from original old WINDOWS text wallet.   1. Downloaded newest wallet. https://github.com/Tomas-M/VoteCoin-wallet/releases/ 2. Put wallet.dat from old wallet into new wallet (resources/app/votecoin) and votecoinid file from old into new (resources/app) 3. Start new wallet. wait for it to sync to block chain to show transactions. It will still give safe mode error. 4. Then Export private keys from back up section on new wallet. 5. Now you dowload a new wallet again,  export to a new folder, open and wait for fresh wallet to sync. 6. Import your keys from back up section.  This is the long winded way but works, make sure you back up those walelet.dat and votecoinid files somewhere else too   If you are updating from original LINUX text wallet, open the old wallet, ignore the safe mode error.  1. Type command $ vot export to get your private keys 2. Download latest wallet from @everyone overwinter update has been completed, get new wallet below... I will make a quick video on how to tansfer coins if needed https://github.com/Tomas-M/VoteCoin-wallet/releases/ 3. Open new wallet and wait to sync 4. Go to Back up tab in new wallet import your keys 5. Wait for resync (wont take long)  Cheers

Author: votecoin.site
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: VoteCoin activated overwinter (new protocol) after block 179999. When this happened, most mining pools (including the official pool) stopped working. For some reason the most commonly used pool software (z-nomp) creates blocks which are refused by the network. In my opinion it is necessary to patch the z-nomp software for the overwinter update, unfortunately I didn't find anything useful yet. If you have any suggestions, please be so kind and share them here. Thank you very much -Tom

Author: votecoin.site
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: Attention Z-NOMP pool owners If you are running VoteCoin pool based on Z-NOMP, your pool will not be able to mine new blocks until you patch it to support the latest overwinter transaction format. The patch can be found here: https://github.com/karel-3d/bitcoinjs-lib/pull/3/files it applies to the following file: Code: ./z-nomp/node_modules/bitcoinjs-lib-zcash/src/transaction.js  After you patch it, you need to make one more change. Find file Code: ./z-nomp/node_modules/stratum-pool/lib/transactions.js In this file, find the following line: Code: var tx = new bitcoin.Transaction(); Add this line after: Code: tx.setOverwinter();  If your pool supports multiple coins, you will need to call tx.setOverwinter() only for VoteCoin (and Zcash) coins. Since we do not run multiple coins, I didn't search for proper solution for multicoin setup. At least you have a starting point here. Hope it helps. -Tom

Author: votecoin.site
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: NEW RELEASE - VoteCoin v1.1.1 and VoteCoin GUI Wallet v1.1.1-125  https://github.com/Tomas-M/VoteCoin/releases/ https://github.com/Tomas-M/VoteCoin-wallet/releases/  This release brings first network upgrade for VoteCoin. Its purpose is strengthening the protocol for future network upgrades. It includes versioning, replay protection for network upgrades, performance improvements for transparent transactions, a new feature of transaction expiry, and more.  Votecoind v1.1.1 (and future releases) running protocol version 170005 will activate Overwinter at which point only v3 transactions are processed. Older versions of votecoind <= 1.0.15, running protocol versions <= 170004, will partition themselves away from the main network into a legacy chain.  Keep your VoteCoin software updated, and you'll be on the newly-upgraded main chain along with everyone else.  There are lots of changes in this release. Read more about the changes in original ZCash blogpost: https://blog.z.cash/new-release-1-1-1/  Please help us test this release and share your comments and suggestions here. Also please report all bugs through the issue system at github.

Author: brooklynite1
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: Hi Tom,  As always, I love your work and I have invested a lot into buying the coin. But now I am somewhat disappointed to see this to say the least.  A short reason ASICs are terrible:  Mining hardware cost is about residual value, not initial cost. The "price" of the equipment is irrelevant. The "price drop" over time is the actual cost. GPU Rigs are worth 60% of their original value in one year. ASICs are worth 5% in one year. So on average the ASIC hardware is depreciating 12x faster than a GPU mining rig. Since most of the ASIC buyers get their ASICs very late, it is even worse for them. So this forces them to "Mine-N-Dump", meaning they keep dumping whatever they mine just trying to money back that they paid for the ASIC equipment first. That ever happens because typically the equipment starts making $5/day per $1000 worth of ASIC and quickly drops to $0/day (remember X11? same is going to happen to A9 and Z9 buyers, except for the YouTube celebrities who get their ASICs 3 months before others to put up video ads). While the ASIC buyers never pay off their equipment, their Mine-N-Dump process (selling every altcoin the mine the same day) continuously lowers the price of the coin. Do the math, even if 10% of those who mined VOT dumped it on an exchange the same day, the price would go down to zero in a week and people stop mining which will in turn kill the coin or make it so easy for someone to do a 51% attack and drain large accounts out of their coins.  Look at this list, you see the ASICs that say they ROI in say 100 days? Thats utterly incorrect because the calculation assumes a flat income on a daily basis while the income quickly drops on the ASIC miner which is logically accurate too because if it was profitable then Bitmain was not STUPID to ship it out, they would just continue to mine with it. https://www.asicminervalue.com/opportunities  So that is why we need the ASICs out of this project or you will watch the price of VOT dwindle down to zero which hurts some of us who bought VOT with actual FIAT money.    Again, I love your project, you have the only VOTING system in the whole Equihash verse.  I just wish you had a mobile app or would do a fork of Bitpay Android app so I could watch the mined coins come to my phone instead of an exchange or my home computer that I never turn on.

Author: brooklynite1
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: What people are not understanding is that the real "cost" is the depreciation of assets.  A $4000 GPU rig today (6x1070) is worth $2800 next year, so net cost is $80/month A $4000 ASIC miner (2xZ9) is worh $400 next year so net cost is $300/month   So asic costs 3.5 times. But the energy consumed, which is a big deal in US and Europe but not in China, is also 3.5x less.  Everyone assumes equipment have zero resale value when they count the NOI. In my case I always sell my GPU cards for almost the same price or just a little less than I buy them on sale. Its like leasing a car, a Lexus has 65% retained value VS a Mercedes has 55%, GPU has 30% and ASIC miner has 0% after 3 years of use.

Author: brooklynite1
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: You seriously need proof? X11 Miner announced at $2700 (July of 2017): https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=2029822.0   Bitmain not sending out the units as late as Oct 2017 because they are still profitable to mine with and Bitmain still mining with them in cleanrooms, (What the fuck, are they retarded to ship them out? why would they??): https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=2029822.3620  X11 Miner Arrived in the hands of the 1st people who purchased (Nov of 2017) at $2700: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RA7lGe_jY7M  X11 Miner sold for $200 (May of 2018): https://www.ebay.com/itm/Authentic-Bitmain-Antminer-D3-19-3gh-s-X11-Dash-Miner-Tested-Working/232761673532?epid=14019131864&hash=item3631ad473c:g:9YMAAOSwQO9a8cen  5 months from $2700 to $200 thats $500/month for owning a D3 ASIC miner. Dumbest thing ever and they didnt even fork to disable the ASICs. The case is a lot worse if someone bought a Monero ASIC or Baikal.  Bitmain mined with that ASIC from say June to Nov with low difficulty and made probably $2000 off of each ASIC plus $2700 from its sale thats $4700. The miners who bought the ASIC made around $800 from Nov to May after electricity so they lost $1900 per ASIC and now its breakeven with electricity cost so its just speculative mining.  To Compare: 5 months ago I paid $3250 for my 7 card GTX1070 miner which is worth pretty much the same today my GPU RIG cost around $0 per month.

Author: votecoin.site
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: I know nothing about IntenseCoin internals. What I was able to learn from the article is this: 1) somebody gained significant hashing power and at the same time he exploited some weakness in IntenseCoin to find 6000 blocks himself. 2) IntenseCoin developers decided that this is bad and they made a hard fork, causing A LOT of troubles.  I believe that there are two problems. First one is the exploitable weakness, and second trouble is mad developers making hard fork as a solution for this problem.  If the very same problem happened with VoteCoin, 6000 blocks would be worth 750K VOT coins, which the "attacker" could actually sell at TradeSatoshi exchange to get 1.33 BTC. The price of VOT would drop down to 100 sat. But that's the worst case scenario. Nobody gets hurt. All coins held by all users would be safe. There would be no need for any hard forking in my opinion.  VoteCoin uses a dificulty adjustment algorithm based on DigiShield v3/v4 [DigiByte-PoW], with simplifications and altered parameters, to adjust difficulty to target the desired 2.5-minute block time. Unlike Bitcoin, the difficulty adjustment occurs after every block. So I would say that VoteCoin does not have such weakness as like IntenseCoin and it would prevent such situation anyway.  There is no need to fear the upcoming ASIC release...  -Tom

Author: Skydreamer
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: The problem is not at all in this. The fact is that the company Bitmain (manufacturer AsicS - supports for the door, hair dryer, heater) just gets rid of used Asics, to sell greedy idiots who want easy money and who eventually lose their money by buying a large calculator that quickly losing profitability. In place of old Asics new more powerful ones will come and if you do not change the algorithm (and I understand why - you use their ZEC network (hello t1) and do what they do? But the greedy Zcash team gets 2.5 coins from each block all the same, even better. And what's the benefit to you? Do you know what will happen in the end? Bitmain with its ASICs will absorb the whole algorithm, all ordinary users will leave you. And you will have one member named Bitmain (hello Bitcoin, Bitcoin Cash, Dash). Electroneum for this reason decided to hold a hard fork for began to lose its community. I, as a holder of Votecoin, are not indifferent to the fate of the coin. So I advise you to think over my words Tom.  Sorry for my English, I write this with Google translate

Author: votecoin.site
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: I do not agree with your conclusions. Bitmain will not "absorb whole algorithm". If bitmain's Z9 miners are successfull and if all ordinary users switch to Z9 miners instead of GPU, then the entire network will be mined with Z9. But that means nothing wrong. It has nothing to do with Bitmain company, they will not absorb anything. Each user will choose his preferred pool.  From what I've read so far in emails and facebook messages and other posts, it looks like people freak out about the upcoming ASICs, it looks like the majority of people think it is very big problem, while I do not share this negative attitude, really, there is no need to be afraid of ASICs in my opinion.

Author: Skydreamer
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: Tom, not to lead a long dialogue, answer a simple question. Do you have the ability to change the algorithm yourself? Yes or no? As I understand you do not have such a technical opportunity, so why then all this to discuss, just admit it, and that you are completely dependent on the network Zcash. As I said before Zcash does not care, because its 2, 5 coins from each block they already get. Votecoin in the first place became famous thanks to miners, who spread the information about your coin. Asic for the average user is a high-risk device. Profitability falls quickly and it becomes worthless. Everything will come to the conclusion that Votecoin will produce large factories and huge farms, and the community you lose, I guarantee you, there are lots of examples. You are not zcash, ethereum, siacoin, and others who can calmly take it, for all have long been known and have a great capitalization.  Asics are in the majority large factories and not thousands of people with their graphic cards

Author: cjl1984
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: The concept of the project is very good, and also meets the actual needs of future development, and the future is full of potential.

Author: votecoin.site
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: Yes, of course, I have the abilities to change the algo myself. To make my life easier, I could even wait for some other project based on Zcash to change the algo, and then backport their changes. But simply following zcash's direction is easiest (and in my opinion most correct) approach. Those ASIC machines released by Bitmain are in no way comparable to the power of bitcoin's ASICs, Z9 provides only ~4x advantage over GPUs, so I do not really understand why are people so overreacting. -Tom

Author: Ainars
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: That is actually good news as I left with impression that you kinda would struggle to change the algo and therefore piggytailing on ZEC.   Z9 provides only ~4x advantage over GPUs, so I do not really understand why are people so overreacting.  It's more than just 4x hashing power. It is 10x less power consumption. 10x time less heat and therefore 10x less heat extraction. also quite a space saver too. ASICs have lots of advantages against GPUs, but lets leave ASIC advantages alone and look on community itself. I see @Skydreamer points/worries. Ordinal miners or just curious people have an option to try and mine VOT and have a play and test it. Somebody with just a single GPU can get involved in VOT. If VOT becomes ASIC driven then you lose out those people and community - running ASIC is a business so if VOT is more of a business project then that's ok, just say it . People would like to know what to do, to leave VOT community or in contrary, join it with ASIC power . What direction are we going? There are some thoughts for you Tom: if you make it ASIC resistant then lots of miners may soon join you. If you do not make it ASIC resistant then ASIC farms will join and so part of community may leave. I am not sure which route is best though. Maybe the best one is the one you are doing - just wait and see , but some may hate such waiting games. There is no way you can please us all .

Author: votecoin.site
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: There was an error on the official VoteCoin pool, it tried to send payments to some invalid address, and since that failed, payments were delayed due to that. It is now fixed and all payments were sent properly.  Also, there was an error in dnsseed servers for VoteCoin, basically there was a full-debug-logging enabled on the dnsseed nodes, and the debug log took 100% of hard disk capacity, and the dnsseed nodes died due to that. This caused problems in sync for new users. This has been also fixed, so new users should be able to connect and sync wallet now without any issues.  We are sorry for the troubles, lets hope it won't happen too often -Tom

Author: Ainars
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: For Zcash maybe, but for 0.5MSol/s VOT network only 50 such miners needed to get control over (or ruin?) the network! Please correct me if I am wrong. And for sure, such network/blockchain cannot be called decentralized voting platform if there will be only couple of main players (mining farms) on the VOT mining market.  The real question is will you be able to sort out the mess if Zcash decides not to fork!? A bigger team (IntenseCoin) made a right mess out of all the forking against ASICs so I am worried about the VoteCoin team capabilities which, I believe, has much smaller team. Please reassure us  Better to be prepared than sorry.  For now I translate such answer as ASICs are welcome to ruin our project/network. A good time to order some ASICs for tests after such answer .

Author: votecoin.site
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: Lets try some math. Current VoteCoin network hash rate is 500 Ksol/s. Bitmain's Equihash miner costs around $2200 including PSU and shipping, while the miner is capable of mining 10Ksol/s.  To get over 50% of hashrate of VoteCoin network, you need to generate another 500 Ksol/s. You would have to buy 50 such ASIC miners, so the cost would be 110 000 USD. (not mentioning that bitmain will sell only 1 device to a single user) (not mentioning that having 51% of hashrate does NOT ruin the network at all)  If you want to get the same hashrate with GTX 1060 cards, you would need 1666 such cards (300 Sol per card), which would cost you around 400 000 USD today. So ASIC gives you only 4x the hashrate for your money. Not mentioning that once the bitmain's ASICs are released, the price for used GPUs will decrease rapidly and you may get 1666 such cards for say 200 000 USD while still getting several years warranty, compared to bitmain's 180 days.  In long term, the ASICs will consume less energy, indeed, so it will be more profitable that GPUs, but other than that, the advantage of having bitmain's ASIC boxes will be insignificant.  -Tom

Author: votecoin.site
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: Exactly for this reason we plan to stick with whatever ZCash decides to do - we will simply adopt their changes and we're happy to go. -Tom

Author: Regulater
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: This is completely not true at all about bitmain limits. If you are a bulk buyer you can buy as many as you want and receive same day as everyone ordering 1. Alibaba trusted resellers are already listing these for presale guaranteeing same day delivery as ordering from bitmain.  ASICs are not the future, and for a coin like this where decentralization is a major factor and you are in favor of centralization, then there is a huge reason for this coin to not become a main use coin. There are plenty of other coins similar that will fight centralization, but you are not going to fight centralization then what is the point of using your coin? Your coin will most likely be hit with several attacks, due to the small size of your coin, and 50 ASICs is nothing compared to what bitmain is selling and has running.

Author: Sparty3
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: Asic are more green consuming less power the progress is inevitable,  me as a miner trusting on my machine to confirm and secure the net I'm just leaving this project and all the equihash and cryptonight algo. Author: votecoin.site
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: Well, I just stated what I read on bitmain's official announcement: "to prevent hoarding and to let more individuals worldwide get one, we've set a limit of one miner per user" https://twitter.com/BITMAINtech/status/992034662875779072    for a coin like this where decentralization is a major factor and you are in favor of centralization, then there is a huge reason for this coin to not become a main use coin. There are plenty of other coins similar that will fight centralization, but you are not going to fight centralization then what is the point of using your coin?  Maybe you are confusing VoteCoin with bitcoinz. VoteCoin is indeed decentralized, but we do not stress our marketing on the "decentralization" idea. Instead, we implement features useful for voting.    Your coin will most likely be hit with several attacks, due to the small size of your coin, and 50 ASICs is nothing compared to what bitmain is selling and has running.  You are spreading fear without understanding the reality at all. There are NO new attacks possibilities when ASIC comes into play. As I explained earlier, if you wish so spend money buying ASICs from bitmain to get 500 KSol/s hashrate (to gain 50% of VoteCoin network hashrate, which itself means nothing bad in general), you would need to spend around 110 000 USD. Nonetheless, you can go to nicehash.com today and purchase equihash hashing power of 500 Ksol/s for 24 hours for only $1955 as of now. All the "apocalyptic scenarios" you are talking about could already happen now, for cheap, regardless of ASIC. So please ...  -Tom

Author: RockyLeesya
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: VoteCoin is a decentralized anonymous platform for elections and other voting purposes, based on Zerocoin protocol. It can simplify public polls, surveys and crowd funding campaigns and create their process more flexible and easily trackable. This new digital currency can strengthen democracy and help people to reach their goals. VoteCoin offers a high standard of privacy and preserves the confidentiality of transactions through sophisticated zero-knowledge proving scheme. VoteCoin source code is based on the peer reviewed Zcash sources.

Author: votecoin.site
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: To find existing poll - go to http://pollexplorer.votecoin.site/ , there is list of all created polls.  To create a poll or vote for existing poll, you must download and run VoteCoin GUI wallet.  After sync is complete:  To create voting pool- click "Vote" in the menu on left side and then "Add poll or campaign". There you can set up your poll.  To vote for existing pool -  click "Vote" in the menu on left side and then paste poll ID (example) into the text field. You can obtain poll ID from the poll organizer or you can find poll ID on the poll explorer page (http://pollexplorer.votecoin.site/).

Author: brooklynite1
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: I think there are two types of exchanges.  A) Exchanges who have tons and tons of fake trades which in turn grabs attention and brings in real traders. Bitfinex, HitBTC, Binance, Bittrex and even Coinbase are notable ones. The US stock market functions in this matter, majority of the trades are bot trades, basically no fee trades that are fabricated between the real people's BIDxASK to create the illusion of huge volumes. IT is estimated that 90% of the US stock market https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2017-06-15/it-s-a-quant-s-stock-market-as-computer-programs-keep-on-buying is bot trades, and I am not talking about bot trades that are between one bot from one institution with another bot from another institution actually doing automatic trades, I am talking about bots fabricating trades with no money or real trades happening in the background.  B) Exchanges who do not take have fake trading bot activity. Some of these are Tradesatoshi and Cryptopia where you can see zero volume and bid spread between bidxask with some altcoins. I typically trust those exchanges a lot more than the larger ones who could collapse like Cryptsy did back in the day.

Author: votecoin.site
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: Just remember that current VoteCoin Wallet does not have refund functionality or any other functionality which would pay out the winning bets. So consider all current sports betting polls as an EXAMPLE only, and do not expect to be paid back, because that would be very hard for the organizer - he will need to go through block explorer to find out all sending addresses and manually send payments back, one by one.  Future versions should handle this easier, but for now it is not yet implemented.

Author: brooklynite1
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: It is very interesting that Tomas actually create a Linux distro OS on his own. How fantastic is that. I think it would be incredible if he could incorporate VOT into the OS and release it as VOTE-OS a linux distribution that has Crypto embedded for voting and purchases on the internet, and allows ad removal by spending VOT where content creator gets a cut (similar to BAT but thats an ICO) so it will be embedded into the browser that is included with the OS. The OS could also have Proof of Stake reward system based on the time the system is ON and tied to the CPU serial number verification to avoid mass duplications within the same system.  The moral of the story is that we need to get the original developer back on board, he can do so much with this coin and his capabilities.

Author: brooklynite1
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: Wholly crap are you Tom? I checked out your Github history and you have been active there for a long time. I am starting to love this project because of your background. Unfortunately I cant buy much every time I put a buy order against DOGE the price creeps up.  Anyway, I think a VOTE-OS could certainly be a hit by integrating the Crypto into the operating system's browser this is something no one has done before and who knows where it will take us. To get adoption by the community, the first release could be one that is used by the miners (similar to EthOS) that boots up and has all drivers etc ready to go. Then in turn the OS  auto converts anything that has been mined by the system into VOTE coins using an API tied to an exchange.  The idea of paid AD removal to protect content creators as opposed to stealing with ADBlock, is actually from BAT, not me and their Brave browser (BAT: https://basicattentiontoken.org). Although I had for years thought of a similar solution, they are the ones who actually did it and when I saw it I thought someone had read my mind. The way it could work is that you can buy VOT coins that will go embedded inside the browser that also acts as your wallet, then you can chose to block off the ads by spending tiny amounts of VOT coins. The author of that website could signup with you to get a big cut of the VOT coins spent on his page. So we are talking about combining LINUX+Miner++Wallet+ADBlock+Chrome+"BAT ideas". Eventually the browser+wallet combo could spin off and be installed on Windows as a standalone product, while still be downloadable as a Crypto-Linux USB stick.  Future roadmaps:  The BTCZ.me technology could be embeded within the Browser or the OS.  Also some payment gateways need to get implemented INSIDE the browser such as this: https://btcz.in/#  Bitpay can be forked for Android wallet like BTCZ team has done.

Author: votecoin.site
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: NEW RELEASE - VoteCoin GUI Wallet v1.0.0-rc1  Download first release candidate of VoteCoin graphical Wallet with voting features here: https://github.com/Tomas-M/VoteCoin-wallet/releases/tag/v1.0.0-rc1  Please note: This version is not backward compatible with any previous release, so there is no way to upgrade from your previous wallet. But of course you can still transfer your coins by sending them from your old (text mode) wallet.  Please help us test this release and share your comments and suggestions here. Also please report all bugs through the issue system at github.  While waiting for your wallet to sync, you can participate in our FB campaign. Just follow the link in the wallet, publish the post on your FB profile and 10 VOT will be automatically sent to your wallet.    And finally, new website is up and running: https://votecoin.site/ Big thanks goes to maxlumnar, who created the whole website! Hope more hard working crypto lovers like max will arise within our community!

Author: brooklynite1
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: This coin is Equihash based so its best mined on GPUs, specifically speaking on nVidia graphic cards.  Simple answer is that you can not mine with CPU.  Long answer is that you may be able to mine it with a mac mini (if you find the right miner, install Linux or something, not sure how) but even when you get it going, you could end up with 60 cents after a year of mining that will cost 10 cents to move to an exchange and $30 in electricity over the course of the year.  For CPU mining, look into Monero but I have been mining since 2013 and I have not been able to mine Monero with my laptop CPU.

Author: maxlumnar
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: Here is a screen of the new features  http://lumnartech.com/votpreview/29102036_10215409249325645_3157545735658930176_o.png  http://lumnartech.com/votpreview/29101965_10215409250885684_3976527726205992960_o.png  (i can't post inline pictures here due to the age of my account, so i put the link to the images)  You can see the different features of the voting section, each comes with its own particularities, but runs on the same core mechanism.  As you can notice from the second screen, a "vote" can be easily distributed to multiple options in different proporions at the same time. This way of voting makes things more intuitive and helps getting a more accurate opinion from the voter. Of course you could vote 100% on a single option if you would want to.  There is also a graphical representation of the results (will post screen soon).

Author: alamobruno
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: This project is very good if you apply the right ideas, it has great potential. I would like to give you an idea, I am Brazilian and here in Brazil we have the electronic ballot, national technology, so this project has great potential to replace electronic voting machines worldwide with a Blockchain based system, much safer and auditable by public, or is impossible to be corrupted. This system could replace the electronic ballot boxes of all countries and be deployed also in low-need countries with high rates of corruption at low cost, since every system will be decentralized.  Sorry for my English, not my first language. I'm Brazilian and I speak Portuguese.

Author: maxlumnar
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: yes exactly, and even if in political elections "cheating" is still part of the system, in most private sectors such a voting mechanism would be highly desired. Also distributing your vote across multiple options makes the final result much more accurate because you have the possibility to share your exact option, not just decide on one option.  Being decentralized and cross platform, it makes it the cheapest to implement and most secure way to use even in high profile decisions/votes...actually much safer than the current electronic voting some countries use.

Author: maxlumnar
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: Staked Polls This is kind of a new concept, even if it is used in certain common situations. It basically means you are betting money on your decision, and push the power of your vote with actual value. "paying for winning" is a major concern, thats why the tiny but powerful option on the lower right side allows poll organizers to limit participation just to the coins they distributed. For example, the organizer could give an equal number of coins to the people that should vote, or variable number of vot coins depending on internal rules of that community (lets say older members get more vote power than new ones). This ensures that raw financial power will not sabotage the vote result.  Decision funding In case it is a public vote, where its all about getting people to invest in one or an other decision (decision funding), then anyone can push as many coins as he wants in his vote, because that wouldn't be sabotage, instead it will fit exactly with the purpose of the poll.  Crowd funding This is similar to decision funding, but used for a different purpose. In a decision funding you might need only members of that specific group or community to participate in the decision, but in crowd funding, it should be possible for anyone to put his money only in the development branch he wishes to.  Public Bets This a very interesting use case scenario. We are not sure if it will be presented as a separate feature or it will be based just on the existing functionality. As an example, an organizer could hold such a public bet, and offer 70% of the accumulated VOT as jackpot/reward to the winner(s), and keep 30% for himself. This would be an interesting way to earn VOT and play at the same time, but we are concerned about technical ways to prevent fraud (ideas are welcome as always).  We have in plan many adjacent features that will make all this easier and more clear to use, but this is a first preview with a more technical perspective of what we are trying to create here     PREVIEW IS HERE:

Author: maxlumnar
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: Hi Gaffary, The voting function is not yet functional in the current release, so i will be talking about what it will do in the next release (that is already  in testing right now). Anyone can run/organize a vote. This is the good part, as you don;t need anything like a masternode or special permissions to do it, you just set up your own poll/election and run it (at the costs required by the network, that are very low). To use the voting you will need to follow intuitive steps from within the interface (in the next release), and to participate in a vote you will need an invite code from whoever organized that vote. The functions are more than just voting, it allows participants to stake an amount of vot coins on their decision, or to transfer funds in case of a crowdfunding. You can read a more complete explenation of each feature (use case) here:  Quote from: maxlumnar on February 26, 2018, 05:10:50 PM Staked Polls This is kind of a new concept, even if it is used in certain common situations. It basically means you are betting money on your decision, and push the power of your vote with actual value. "paying for winning" is a major concern, thats why the tiny but powerful option on the lower right side allows poll organizers to limit participation just to the coins they distributed. For example, the organizer could give an equal number of coins to the people that should vote, or variable number of vot coins depending on internal rules of that community (lets say older members get more vote power than new ones). This ensures that raw financial power will not sabotage the vote result.  Decision funding In case it is a public vote, where its all about getting people to invest in one or an other decision (decision funding), then anyone can push as many coins as he wants in his vote, because that wouldn't be sabotage, instead it will fit exactly with the purpose of the poll.  Crowd funding This is similar to decision funding, but used for a different purpose. In a decision funding you might need only members of that specific group or community to participate in the decision, but in crowd funding, it should be possible for anyone to put his money only in the development branch he wishes to.  Public Bets This a very interesting use case scenario. We are not sure if it will be presented as a separate feature or it will be based just on the existing functionality. As an example, an organizer could hold such a public bet, and offer 70% of the accumulated VOT as jackpot/reward to the winner(s), and keep 30% for himself. This would be an interesting way to earn VOT and play at the same time, but we are concerned about technical ways to prevent fraud (ideas are welcome as always).  We have in plan many adjacent features that will make all this easier and more clear to use, but this is a first preview with a more technical perspective of what we are trying to create here    PREVIEW IS HERE:

Author: maxlumnar
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: It is not about political elections! It is a system that helps all sorts of polls and elections (community elections, company decisions, crowd opinion). Political elections will never change anytime soon and that is not our target. Our purpose is to offer a very secure and democratic way of raising funds, financing decisions, and allowing participants in a vote (all sort of situations where a vote is needed), to sustain their decision with a financial involvement.  I hope that makes things more clear, if not please explain your concern

I am sorry for not being multi-language right now, but as the demand increases we might consider offering the interface or at least the documentation in multiple languages. Currently our main focus is on the functionality and development. Thank you for understanding.

Author: votecoin.site
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: Internal support for voting means modifying the way how the underlaying zcash core handles outgoing transactions in VoteCoin - in particular, allowing multiple outputs to the same address within the same transaction. This was introduced by VoteCoin for the voting mechanism, and the very same changes will also be used by the hush protocol now, since they incorporated it into their fork as well - the same method but for different reason.  -Tom

Author: maxlumnar
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: Tradesatoshi is not very intuitive at all..but its functional eventually. I had some problems with it too until i learned how it works.  As a short tutorial, once you are on the VOT trading page, you check the available SELL orders (if you want to BUY), or the available BUY orders if you want to sell, then put your price equal to the first offer that has the amount of coins you want, or just the first buy/sell offer. When you click the offers, the numbers change in your BUY/SELL sections above, be sure you change the amount you want to buy or sell before submiting.  If there are not enough offers to cover the number of coins you want to buy/sell at the price you desire, you can wait untill the market fluctuates and the price reaches your desired price, or you can change the price to match the next avaiable offer.  If you are not used to exchanges or have little experience with trading i suggest you be very careful at the totals, or do just a test till you get used to it first. This exchange works in fact very similar with other exchanges, but somehow the interface is confusing many times because of the way and the order you need to click things and the way those fields get auto-filled with data..a nightmare..but eventually works.  For me, a VOT withdrawal yesterday worked in about 30min and a ZEC deposit in about 2 hours

Author: achillez
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: So interesting concept - I have been considering a form of vote coin for sometime. However, the big issue I see with this votecoin is the concept is whoever owns the coin gets more votes. In short, golden rule = the one with the gold makes the rules. This isn't a true democratic coin. In order to be democratic everyone needs to have an equal/fair voice. If not, some big fish can come in and buy the votes.

Author: votecoin.site
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: If you are a big fish, lets say you buy votes and influence voting. Well, then the votes you bought are TRANSFERRED by the action of voting to the organizer of the poll/election/crowdfund. Please describe what you consider wrong in this example. People with money will influence the results while PAYING their money for their opinion. They will end up losing money. This seems fair to me.  Democracy does not mean "equal voice". Democracy means "rule of the people". People decide. But the concept of fair votes in recent democratic elections is rather new, unusual, and imho dangerous. Not long ago, half of the population couldn't vote at all (women). And not even longer ago, lots of other people couldn't vote as well (slaves) and nobody had any problem with Democracy at that time. I'm not saying that women shouldn't have voting right, I'm not even propagating slavery, I am just saying that the whole concept of democracy is different than you assume and it changes during time.  -Tom

This is work in progress currently.  -Tom

Author: maxlumnar
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: It is good to discuss and analyze the theoretical use of this system in country elections, as a concept, because it allows us to learn from past mistakes and improve existing situations, but please keep in mind that this is designed for practical use, such as community (of all kinds) elections, polls and crowdfunding.  The new wallet release will contain features discussed here and we are genuinely considering all your opinions and concerns about VoteCoin functionality.  Also please remember this is an ongoing project, with many features that are not yet announced because we find better ways to do them as the project evolves, and we do not want to "promise" features that won't become true.  Expect significant updates in a couple of days

Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: on the one hand, in my opinion, this is not really an ideal situation it's exactly what happens in the US elections with big donations, those rich people with the moneys don't mind paying a lot to get their ways because it's worth it to them,  Quote from: votecoin.site on February 19, 2018, 01:36:03 PM I forgot to add, that with VoteCoin, we're also considering ways how to enable "equal voice" votes, which would include a possibility for government to distribute only certain VOT coins to the citizens of given country, and let the citizens vote in some political elections using those "special" VOT coins only, so the elections couldn't be influenced by "big fishes" or even by people from different states. This is work in progress currently. -Tom  on the other hand, this "equal voice" concept sounds like a good solution to this kind of situations. Maybe different procedures of voting can be used for different purposes, and developing this platform to offer these solutions and solve current problems it a noble idea and we need to develop it to be versatile and general to be able to cover different scenarios and offer real and practical solutions to be used in many different kinds of situations.  I'm liking this more and more

Author: maxlumnar
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: This issue was addressed. Once the new release will be out i'll be able to discuss more about the implemented solution.  In my opinion (and please correct me if i am wrong), the only way one could control the fairness of votes inside a community (company, country, game, etc), is through ways specific to that community only. For example if the organizer of the election can limit the votes to 1 per participant, but make that vot value arbitrary, yet limited(!), that means that they can avoid this situation. An other example would be to limit voters to a set everyone agrees they should vote, so they avoid participants that could sabotage the vote.  These concepts have been extensively discussed and a technical solution has been found. It will be presented in a raw, more technical way in the next release, but it will be improved in the future.  This problem where a voter could sabotage a vote just because he can afford it, was one of my main concerns when joining this team. My concept solution to this is to "tranfer" this problem to the organizer of the poll/ellection/fund and offer him technical ways to do it from within the interface. I thought this so because each individual community knows best how to prevent such things in their own ways already, and VoteCoin should also be usable for crowdfunding where "paying more" is a benefit not an issue (unlike voting).  Presenting all these quite distinct functionalities in a coherent and well integrated way will be our next challenge.

Author: crypt~o~saurus
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: Hi Max  You're doing an excellent job of keeping interested peeps (like me) informed of the progress of this project as well as your obvious enthusiasm for VoteCoin, so very well done there.  I'll keep this brief and sketch out the main (but by no means the only) use of VoteCoin that I see - apologies if this turns out to be longer than anticipated...  As the coin actually represents a financial commitment when voting, then I don't think there should ever be a possibility of simply losing your money if you don't 'win the vote'. Rather, voting on some project priorities strikes me as a much better plan. As an example, voting on which wallet for a crypto coin should be developed with a GUI first (windows, linux, MacOS). This way, all three options will eventually materialise and the development time can either be divided as a simple 1st, 2nd, 3rd or a percentage of dev time weighted directly on the votes cast to the relevant windows/linux/MacOS wallets.  More generally, I'm thinking something along the lines of crowdfunding, but also including steering project direction through a voting mechanism. Effectively, funding and steering a project through it's development phase (and beyond).  So how would this work in practice? Well setting up a MySQL (or other) db to store options/results/project details/wallet addresses etc. which would be accessed from the clients wallet would be the way I'd tackle something like this, but I'm sure you'll have plenty of your own ideas.  I can probably elaborate on this a bit, but just thought I'd run this past you as a possibility before going into any great detail...

Author: maxlumnar
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: hi crypt~o~saurus , first of all thank you for sharing your view. To make sure i understand it well , what you mean is that votes should "win" any way, but just decide the priority of the decisions to be made, decisions that will eventually be all made (like various wallet types for a coin), correct? if not please give an example.  I already suggested the development of a refund system for "losing" votes and this feature is currently analyzed to see its potential implementation in a secure way. I CAN NOT confirm that this will be one of the features but i can confirm it is one of the features serioulsy considered right now.  I would like a bit more details on your suggestion in case i missunderstood it.  Thank you

Author: crypt~o~saurus
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: Hi Max  Yes, the whole concept would be of funding and steering a project through a publicised project's roadmap and, in effect, allowing people to buy into the timescale of development by committing funding to various aspects of the project. But yes, there would never be any financial losses as work would progress in the direction determined by voting. I wouldn't expect voting to be the main source of funding for a project, but I'm sure VoteCoin could be used in some way to raise initial capital also. Dependant on the project, there may also be a reward in some form based on the level of a person's contribution

I'll be gathering your ideas and make a plan , sort of a wishlist, for the next stage of the project after the stable release of the wallet that will include a basic use of the voting feature. Your ideas are very valuable, please feel free to share your thoughts also on possible issues we should present or anything else you consider important.  All ideas will be reviewed, but just some implemented (obviously).  VoteCoin is a live project and i wish to keep in touch with the actual uses and wishes of this community.

Author: maxlumnar
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: A totally new site is in work right now!  There are many issues with the current site that might inspire lack of confidence, but these issues will be solved as i announced earlier.  My team is working on the new site independently of the votecoin project devs but under their supervision regarding the content, and once up we will keep it updated too.  If you have suggestions as to what is missing on the site and you wish to see it there, or better presented, feel free to email me directly at max at lumnar . com (subject line: votecoin site suggestions), and i will take into considerations all suggestions.  Please remember that this project started with limited funds so community support and suggestions is more than welcome. Things are difficult to keep updated when focus of devs is on the wallet and product itself, so i excuse on behalf of them for this temporary inconvenience.

Author: maxlumnar
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: The voting functionality is the main purpose of this coin, so a new wallet makes sense to be presented as well as it deserves only with this functionality released. Ofc the site needs updates, but i explained this in the previous post. Some are still using the earlier CLI version of the wallet right now so consider this as an advantage for those that see the true potential of this project and are interested to read this forum, and for the rest that just stumble upon the site, this is a marketing mistake that will be fixed when marketing will make sense  This is not yet an out of the box product, it is an ongoing project, you need to be patient. I think the low market price of the coin reflects this very well right now.

Author: maxlumnar
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: much appreciated   great things have been achieved by people that believed in what they did not by those doing stuff trying to get rich quick or influence markets.  From my perspective i see this as a great opportunity to contribute in something that i personally believe it could be significant to the future ways we see the concept of voting+funding (i think a new word is needed here lol). I absolutely don't care of the market price of this coin, even though i want to see it valued properly one day. I have 18 years of experience as a developer and zero as a market trader, i am not some noob trying to catch a 'job',... i have plenty of things of my own do deal with daily, and people to manage, yet i WANT to help this project out personally because i see its something that could matter, in a way that i will feel honored later to know i helped even a bit. I have an impressive work portfolio, i don't lack acknowledgement.  If there is anyone out there that can actually help in any way with this, follow my example and lets help these guys make a great productm and compensate the points where they are not that strong. Devs where a bit reluctant to accept help in the first place, but lets be serious, who doesn;t need an extra mind at work towards same purpose.  I am not telling you "buy coins they are great", i dont have enough to get a profit at all, i have all my liquidities stuck in other exchanges, but i wont sell the votecoins i have anyway lol, what i am saying is that if you are a professional in some field that might help, and you have some spare time and don't expect to be paid for it (even though you might actually be rewarded for your efforts), dedicate a fraction of your "resources" to help this project grow as fast as its needed to survive the crypto explosion nowdays, where big companies start to "Centralize" the concept of descentralization.  If the devs personally refuse direct help, the truth still stands that an underfunded and unstaffed project has a hard time to surface. i am willing to centralize your help offers, to analyze them and to decide if any of your available capabilities can be put to fair and useful use, then present them for final decision to the devs.  For example i am looking for passionate people that can help me spellcheck content on the new site (i am not a native english speaker), test it out and give feedback before its even presented in any way, so in the end it will come out great. I wont pay you, this is not a job offer, but you might receive VOT from the devs if your effort matters, and from me as well, from my personal stash that is (unless things evolve and vote.coin will agree to let me handle this aspect of their development, ..something i never asked, but will be willing to do if they ever consider this helps the project.  Maybe they are fully capable of doing this alone and i am wasting my time, but i dont think so. I think they are slow due to lack of funds to fully invest in a larger workforce and being slow in this kind of market is suicidal.  I will discuss this with them today and if i am totally wrong about their current capabilities and plans i will remove this post. But at this moment, my opinion stands, any help matters. Even if you let someone else know about this project matters, or report a bug or more .  Let me get back to you about this idea, and as i said, it might be stupid idea, if so i will remove it, but if not, i will give you more update on it.

Author: maxlumnar
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: Hi guys, i need your opinion on this one. I've been discussing with dev the subtle renaming of the main words that define this coin, and i think i have an alternative that fits more with the actual use (that will be implemented in a couple of month probably) ...please share your opinion on this if you would like to:  "Elections" and "poll" could be rephrased to "Decision funding" and "staked poll"  the reason behind this is that VOT enables participants to a poll to spend VOT and both finance and stake money on their decision choice. Also election is too much connected to politics, at least where i come from, and this might cause confusion. Tbh i don't see political elections migrate in any way to any different "system", so a better wording for the use of this coin is neccessary to explain its use  Do you think its good? do you find it confusing?  Please share your opinion  much appreciated. (i need this for the new site)

Author: maxlumnar
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: We need your help.  I need your personal view on how VOT would be used in actual examples, in the circumstances you consider or explain why a decentralized system of this kind would be useful and where.  From the info you (all that want to help) will provide, i will try to get a better view of how such a system is expected to work, and see what from these opinions is feasible technically or fit VoteCoin concept and purpose better.  Please send me use-case scenarios and tell me why your example should work like that and what are its advantages in your opinion.  I will read and analyze all your messages, and i will be rewarding all really valuable idea that will get implemented with a symbolic VOT reward.  (i don;t know how much the reward will be, because i am not sure how valuable the ideas will be and how many, but i will be spending some of my stash to support this at least at a symbolic level if not more)  (you can contact me via message in here, public or private, or email to max at votecoin.site . Public replies would be better i think, but in that case discussing your idea more in depth wont be possible.)

Author: maxlumnar
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: Dev team needs those coins to support the use of such a new feature in the near future, by giving some of them as bounty and rewards when the voting mechanism is functional (info dev confirmed me), thats why the premine. For example promoting this project on facebook (share it), will give you a VOT reward so you can start USING it. This coin is not designed as a money alternative, but a more complex functional funding and voting integrated mechanism. The dev behind it doesn't seem to be a multi corp style business but more a passionate team that works on this without other alternatives of being funded other than the project itself.  The Dev team needs funds to do all this, to promote everything and to develop everything. This started based on Zcash as a "copy paste" project, but the work done to improve zcash and adapt it to their purpose if an entirely different thing. This is not just a zcash clone. It just uses it so it can work based on the only truely anonymous mechanism , with zero knowledge proofs, it is an alternate use of the zcash tech.  When all cryto money alternatives drop and rise and become uncertain, a coin that can actually be used will be much more stable. I am hoping the dev will manage to implement the features we discussed and allow me to announce them properly, till then i can't tell more about what's to come.   All i can say for now is that i believe in the potential of this project and its a considerable share of my crypto portfolio, not because i want it to grow and sell, but because i want to start using it as soon as possible in my gaming sites network. I won't give links here so this won't sound as advertisement, but it is a significant list of projects i plan to adapt to use votcoin.  More info from me will come ONLY when dev will confirm i can discuss those features publicly, and probably at the same time the site will get updated presenting the true power of this coin.

Author: votecoin.site
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: GUI Wallet will re-download the zkSNARK proving key (900 MB) and then it will sync blockchain. If you have synced blockchain from CLI wallet, you can copy the entire directory VoteCoin from your CLI wallet to the gui wallet to directory resources\app\ so you will end up with files such as: C:\VoteCoin-GUI-wallet\resources\app\VoteCoin\blocks\blk00003.dat  Just make sure to erase votecoin.conf from your copied directory within the GUI wallet, as it is re-generated when GUI wallet starts.  -Tom

Author: maxlumnar
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: The current voting mechanism is still under heavy work. There are many things that will be decided on the way based on use case scenarios. I think it is prematurely to announce details about the way the voting functionality will be achieved at a technical level. The team is working on things that require different concepts but hope to realize them on existing technological mechanisms. If they will use sharding as a data distributing process or not is not something i know right now, but i know that even if they will, they will prefer to focus on actual development than to announce in detail plans that might change and improve even before getting released.  This is not the type of company that focuses on advertising details about their future "potential" work, but instead focus on actually doing them and then documenting them once released and properly tested.

Author: votecoin.site
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: Important We've identified a bug in GUI wallet version 0.1.4, which prevents the wallet from shutting down properly. The wallet stays running on background even if you close its window.  Users are strongly encouraged to update to GUI Wallet version 0.1.5 as soon as possible. Download here: https://github.com/Tomas-M/VoteCoin-wallet/releases  If you are currently running version 0.1.4, click the close button, wait for the window to close, then copy the new release 0.1.5 or newer over your existing installation and run votecoin.exe. Then you can close the window again, and it will properly shutdown the wallet.  We apologize for the inconvenience
