Author: maxlumnar
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: YESS!!   thats the entire thing about this coin, it will have a practical and actually usable mechanism for crowdfunding and voting.  It is a new concept of voting, where one can "fund" a particular option he wishes. Basically by voting you also finance with a small (or big) amount that particular thing you are voting for.  It is a mixture between public funding and voting, bringing under one hood whats most useful in both  and of course it allows true annonimity if you wish (not mandatory), and such a think can be very useful in many cases where votes or funds should be gathered anonymous.  They present it as "election system" but its not about political elections, its more useful and complex than that. I made this last remark because for some non native speakers like myself, "election" means "political" and it might create confusion.  Also so far, i am using their new wallet and transactions happen nearly instantly, with zero fees (but selectable fees for when the network will need it).

Author: votecoin.site
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: As far as we know, there is no such incentive. The reason is simple, there is no VoteCoin development fund. If there is enough demand and we see support from pools, we can set up development fund address, where pools could transfer percentage of their fee or people can send donations.  But we think, we need to get listed on some major exchange first, to be able to exchange VOT for BTC and vice versa.  We negotiated with a small exchange and they should list VOT within 2 weeks. However, our main goal is still listing on Bittrex or Poloniex.

Author: maxlumnar
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: Issues with ZCASH that affect votecoin wallet functionality!  I had a terrible night trying to figure this one out, becaue its not my area of expertise, but here are the conclusions that might help others too.  ZCASH (i am using zcash4win) and the VOTEcoin daemons are in conflict, you can't run them together without issues.  The problem happened to me when i wanted to open my zcash wallet that had some funds in it, but it was never able to sync. After looging at debug logs i realized there is a deprecation flag because zcash is marked as deprecated after a certain point, and the daemon won't work unless explicitly told so and/or updated.  i found useful files here: https://github.com/radix42/zcash4mac/tree/zcash4win-12/win     i got my zcash out of there..if these people are unable to work on a better interface in such a long time i am already losing my hope in their capabilities or interests.. (buying vot with them )  but i still have an issue with transactions confirming and blockchain updating in the VOT wallet.  I suspect this is related to the same issue and it needs that flag set and daemon and cli updated, but i don't know how to do it, so i will forward my findings to the dev team and they will find a solution.  Maybe its just me because i am running both zcash and vot on the same machine, i really don't know, but i posted this for others that face the same issue.  run the .bat or set the option for deprecation automanitcally, then update zcashd and zcash-cli, and you are good to go woth zcash. Hopefully VOT releases a fix to this but i know they are ultra busy now working on the voting functionality.

Author: votecoin.site
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: There may be few problems, I will try to address them.  Fist problem is the deprecation policy, which is inherited from ZCash by all its forks. There is an automatic deprecation shutdown feature which will halt the node some time after 16 week time period after the release date, and you can run such node only after adding the parameter to the config file as described by maxlumnar. The problem with swing wallet probably is that it incorporates version 1.0.12 of zcash, which is now considered deprecated, and for that reason swing wallet needs that parameter specified. We tend to update VoteCoin wallet monthly and we keep track with zcasch changes. That means, VoteCoin wallet (newest version) is now updated to 1.0.14 core, so there is no need for that disabledeprecation parameter in any way. We also plan to keep track with ZCash core in the future, so our wallets should not have such issue.  Second problem is probably in the RPC port settings. VoteCoin inherited RPC port from Zcash, so it is not possible to run VoteCoin and ZCash wallets simultaneously, unless you specify different port. We will address this by changing the default RPC port in VoteCoin in some future release. For the GUI Wallet, the RPC port is set automatically to a different value, so it should not matter. But the CLI wallet still uses the default rpc port which is the same as for zcash, so you can't run both wallets simultaneously unless you specify rpcport=12345 manually in config file.  Finally, if you are having problems with GUI wallet syncing with the network, your node can be temporarily blacklisted by the dnssed node or by other nodes for some reason. You can try two solutions: first, try to restart your computer, to make sure the daemon is not stuck at the background. Then, if your wallet is still not connecting, make sure to shutdown the wallet cleanly and wait 30 minutes, then try to start it again.  If nothing ever helps and your sync is stuck at some block, try to remove everything from VoteCoin directory, including 'chainstate' subdirectory and 'blocks' subdirectory and also files like peers.dat etc ... remove everything there and only keep votecoin.conf and wallet.dat (this is important). Then try to start the wallet again, it should fetch the entire blockchain.  Alternatively you can try to run votecoind.exe -reindex too  Hope this helps -Tom

Author: maxlumnar
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: Thank you! this solution works for me now.        I also ran Quote votecoind.exe -reindex  in the cli version and it started resync the wallet in there too  Much appreciated for the fast reply!

Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: The network solution rate displayed during resync shows you historical value, which was valid at the time. If you are at block 100 for example, you will see network solution rate at ~3Sol/s. Once the blockchain downloads fully to your node, it will show the actual network solution rate.  -Tom

Author: votecoin.site
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: I'm really sorry for the disappointment. We were able to collect only about 15% of our target during ICO, and for that reason everything takes much longer than expected. But I can assure you we are still on the track and our best intention is to make everything working as soon as possible.  After we have GUI wallet, we will be able to provide plugins for website owners, so they can integrate voting functionality into their websites, so users can vote by clicking on a hyperlink in browser (wallet will open). It will allow users and website owners to both earn and spend money (coins), and to use VoteCoin for real-life voting purposes, which is the main goal - and I believe this is the main factor which will drive up the future price of the coin.  -Tom

Author: maxlumnar
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: I talked with the developer of this coin, brainstorming some ideas, and i must say this coin is very much alive!  They are working hard to implement features nobody else ever even tried. The main (huge) issue is that it is traded only on ..probably the worst..exchange i ever used.. but the coin and the tech behind it is actually useful and they will very soon prove its true value.  Not that i want to brag about it, but i will be implementing this on my online community as a test as soon as it is ready for a full scale test.  I can tell you there are some really awesome goodies in work that will change everything. This is not just an other currency alternative but an entire mechanism designed for a functional purpose. Its this sort of "coins" that survive when the basic alternate payment systems are already in place and need no other competition.  If at least 10% of the features i heard will be implemented become functional, and i know they will, you will see the awesomeness of this tech (sorry i can't call it a coin, its more of a tech than a currency)  Good luck guys , this thing is something that has actual usable value. Lets write history here !   ps. Why on earth don't you present your already functional features on the site, people think its dead even if they are not, and crowd opinion counts!

Author: ByzHash
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: Can we maybe have a list of recommended pools which donate .5% or 1% to the community for projects which can then be voted on how to use the funds, like getting listed on other exchanges or other marketing things? Then have another list of other pools, I think having more pools is a simple way to gain awareness.  Another option is to have someone create a pool or work with a pool to donate 100% of hashing power for "x" amount of time or until a certain target is reached. Then ideas which are voted on can be funded this way. If everyone dedicates some hashing power to accomplish a goal and increase the value of the coins they are HODLing it can go a long way. You can make it fun by maybe adding a jackpot so someone can win say "x" amount of coins for donating their time like a lottery.  Also, getting onto other exchanges will increase the value of the coin too, which will give some more money for marketing too.  Also, maybe look for any chance for this dev team to work with another coins pod or dev team. Either they help with development of VoteCoin or we help with their coin. Both coins will win as the users of each will learn about the coin.  Though, I think the dev just needs to keep doing what he is doing and making practical useful upgrades and features available. Let the coin speak for itself. I like the fact they aren't caught up in self promotion and focusing on the task at hand, that alone speaks volumes.

Author: votecoin.site
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: Actually we have no problem changing the default port, but the question is, will this help? What port is configured in BarterDEX code? If BarterDEX has the default port (8232) for VoteCoin, then if we change it, user will still need to configure BarterDEX. I've contacted barterdex devs to let them know beforehand we're going to change it and also to recommend new port. -Tom

Author: flowjob
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: Im a not one of the devs, but also part of the team :-) We found a good solution, i think. BarterDEX now looks for the parameter rpcport in votecoin.conf and if present uses that instead of the one from his own config, which points to the default one (8232). So no need to change it on your side.

Author: votecoin.site
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: VoteCoin for MAC OS (textmode wallet)  We've been able to successfully port VoteCoin core (textmode) wallet to MAC OS! This means we will also be able to release GUI Wallet for Mac OS, so all three platforms (Windows/Linux/Mac) will be supported from the beginning, with no additional delay.  Macos binaries should be released in a week or so, after some testing, which is always necessary.

Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: hmmm - I can't see how I would get historic data from that at the moment (and I doubt it would ever be at the 1 min resolution) - is it possible? Currently I'm using the tradesatosh api to get the current rates and simply save this to a mySQL db. This gives me the scope to setup the data in any format I want using a SQL query, so for example those candle chart things would have 30 min intervals with a time, high, low, open and close value in each row of the dataset

Author: votecoin.site
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: You can setup your port in config file votecoin.conf Simply put there rpcport=1234 and that's it  -Tom

Author: votecoin.site
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: What do you mean by old version? Did you use the VoteCoin textmode wallet? Well that is not upgradable to GUI wallet. Or did you use some of the pre-alpha releases of the VoteCoin GUI wallet? Then you should be able to just flash the newest version over. If this doesn't help, you can try putting the newest GUI wallet in a separate folder and copy over just wallet.dat file from your old version to VoteCoin-wallet\resources\app\VoteCoin\wallet.dat  -Tom

Author: flowjob
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: Yes, sure, that is what i did, but that also means that every user must do this prior to using BarterDEX and it must match the one that is configured in BarterDEX code, which normally is the default one, but in this case i would have to put an arbitrary port in the code and the user will have to search for it in the code and use it as value for rpcport... it is much more work to do for the enduser.

Author: votecoin.site
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: Official update from VoteCoin dev  Hello everybody, thank you very much for your interest in VoteCoin!  In the past week, VoteCoin market cap reached $2 million USD. Price has raised to ~500 sat, peaking at 680 sat per coin, and then falling to ~350 sat as of now. It seems to be a great opportunity to buy now, before the price raises again. It may of course fall down too, so please do not take this as an investment advise ;-)  We have submitted VoteCoin to almost all reasonable exchanges and we keep submitting to new exchanges on weekly basis, but as of now the only exchange which accepted VoteCoin for trading is tradesatoshi.com  Maybe you noticed that tradesatoshi.com had some technical problems in the last 4 days, and it was hard or impossible to buy or sell. As far as I can see, these problems are now fixed, lets hope it will be stable.  TradeSatoshi does not accept new user registration now, so if you desperately need to buy some VOT, you may try to ask some friend, or alternatively you may PM us here and we will help to arrange the trade for you using our account (only buy orders, and only for 20K VOT or more).  We continue our work on the GUI wallet, it should be in a beta stage during the last week of January 2018. I'll post here as soon as there are any news.  -Tom

Author: votecoin.site
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: Hi, thanks for the suggestion.  Building masternode system seems like good idea, but we're afraid it is not possible with VOT. One of VoteCoin characteristics is that we removed 20% founders reward. The whole reward from mined block goes to miners. So there is no "fund" we could use to pay rewards for masternode operators.

Author: votecoin.site
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: And don't worry guys, VOT is far from dead.  As you might have noticed, someone earlier in this thread have mentioned VOT addition to barterDEX.  We have worked with komodoplatform and they successfully tested atomic swaps with VOT. They also have added VoteCoin to the barterDEX application, so in next version it should be tradable from the GUI!  We're now setting up the liquidity provider node for barterDEX, so there will always be enough VOT for swaps.  Meanwhile we are still working on GUI Wallet.  Oh, I almost forgot: Happy New year!   Now you can ask us for wallet

Author: skelligton
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: Don't think I've ever heard so much drivel. This morning I had never even heard of Electron until reading about it in this thread as the preferred option for wallet development, so thought I'd give it a spin. Easily managed to set this up in VS and I now have a wallet using the Electron framework which has comparable capabilities to the thing you've posted - and includes the coinmarketcap-api for ticker output. If I can do this in under 24 hours then I fail to see why you even need a team of developers...  ...oh, wait a minute...  okay - that's export (wallet keys in human readable format) and backup implemented - was going to do encryption but discovered this was removed from zcash for reasons best known to the zcash developers and hence, this same state of affairs has been inherited by votecoin  and all less than 2 days development - I'll leave you to draw your own conclusions...

Author: votecoin.site
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: Releases of VoteCoin GUI wallet (currently pre-alpha only for Windows) are available here: https://github.com/Tomas-M/VoteCoin-wallet/releases Current status: - showing balance and transaction history partially works - sending transactions partially works - receiving should work fine - voting and other settings not yet available.  Please keep in mind that the code may be broken at any point in time so if you wish to test, make sure to spend only small amounts of VOT.  How to run: 1) download release ZIP 2) unpack 3) run votecoin.exe 4) if you get errors, feel free to report. If you are missing features, WAIT until the first quarter of 2018 Thank you for your patience   Screenshot follows:

Author: ianj
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: I don't have screen grabs at the moment but around 22nd November at 9am if i recollect (a little b4 cmc listing VOT) we started to get transactions showing a buy, about every 15 mins +/- 3 mins, value about 13k +/- 3k VOT - the prices it showed filling at were always within the spread by about 2 sat. This would imply posting an offer 2 -3 sat below the best offer and hitting it immediately from another account before it shows on the order book. The cost  is commission and no net change in position - ie it is inventory neutral  Around the same time a much smaller model was set up, again on a regular schedule +/- a few mins, buying 10-15 vot at the ask price  Occasionally this "accumulation" pressure reversed but i never track it as it only amounted to about 50-100 vot per hour  Intersperse with this are occasional "real" trades  The period and size of these patterned trades have changed and you can only see them as far as the history shows so no way to demonstrate unequivocally without access to the history (API anyone)  I just took a cursory glance and the pattern is still there but the baseline numbers have change on the wash trading - it looks like a slightly wider range (6k-15k) but it still looks to be 15m +/- 3 mins

Author: votecoin.site
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: VoteCoin 1.0.13 was just released introducing new features, performance improvements and bug fixes from ZCash 1.0.13.  The new low-memory prover reduces memory usage by 43% when generating a shielded transaction, from 3 GB to 1.7 GB.  An experimental feature in 1.0.13 is payment disclosure which can help services better manage their shielded payments. It is method of proving that a payment was sent to a shielded address. In the typical case, this means enabling a sender to present a proof that they transferred funds to a recipient's shielded address.  We also now fully support the z_shieldcoinbase RPC call to help miners sweep up and shield their coinbase rewards.  Download the latest release here: https://github.com/Tomas-M/VoteCoin/releases/

Body: But we do need some demonstration of activity . You guys would not get so much earache if you actually communicated with your community - or what remains of it. Simply saying "something coming" is only gonna work for so long.  So Yobit - nothing happened - was it the exchange or maybe it was never submitted. Why is that ? The problem is not one less exchange listing but WHY it was ignored by Yobit !!! Wallet - You offered 3 options as week or so ago, but nothing more - Is that it now until christmas or 2018? SLAX - You intimated at some form form of cross fertilisation - What is that - we have heard nothing more Great voting features - but no other detail - Be more specific ! At least an idea  Just enough tidbits to stop a complete dump but not enough for any form of commitment  I am considering producing my own coin some time soon and you guys are teaching me a great lesson - guess what that is ?  Thanks

We would like to have prototype of GUI wallet by the end of December 2017 2. Author: ridd
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: Hi, I edit my (vot.bat) file, if someone want do the same only check this 3 parameters, just right click over "vot.bat" and edit file...   Code: if "%1" == "status" (    votecoin-cli z_getoperationresult    votecoin-cli getinfo    goto exit )   if "%1" == "totals" (    votecoin-cli z_gettotalbalance    votecoin-cli listaddressgroupings    goto exit )  if "%1" == "key" (    votecoin-cli dumpprivkey %2      goto exit )   :help     echo ""    echo "Helper script to make VoteCoin operations easier"    echo "Supported syntax:"    echo ""    echo "   $0 addr"    echo "   $0 zaddr"    echo "   $0 send FROM TO AMOUNT"    echo "   $0 status"    echo "   $0 totals"    echo "   $0 key WALLET"    goto exit  :exit   Nou you can "remember" your wallet address with "vot.bat totals" and get more info with "vot.bat status"  Also you can print Privkey with "vot.bat key WALLETADDRESS", you need too use your WalletAddress here...  enjoy it.

Author: ianj
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: My thoughts !  If you wanted to make a really great voting coin, but you wanted to avoid Ethereum (because value and function have been conflated) you should implement Rootstock off the side of an independent coin, which has value, but not necessarily tied to Ethereum or some other large coin.  Let the market decide what value it has (one vote for VOT) but give it better technology to represent the voting functionality (Rootstock like technology)  Anyone care to dance ?

Author: ianj
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: It depends on whether you want a functional coin that has value that is not necessarily linked with BTC. It is not certain that BTC will be the highest increase in value as a percentage since its market cap is already high. An altcoin can easily get a 1000% improvement in value. Perhaps it is better to keep value separate from function.  If you used RSK with bitcoin you would get the association with Bitcoin value and the functionality of smart contracts

In fact, no matter how many people supported, the main thing is how much money was received. And for voting at the political level, it will naturally be necessary to develop the idea substantially.

Author: votecoin.site
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: We second that. Being listed on more exchanges does not increase value of the coin. The product people will use does!  That does not mean we are not trying to get VOT listed by more exchanges, but it's not as easy as most of you probably think:  VOT team: "Hey, would you list our coin on your exchange." Exchange: "Sure thing! What problem does your coin solve?" VOT team: "Uhm.. well, it does nothing, but we plan to add some cool stuff." Exchange: "That's cool bro, we'll list your coin tomorrow." VOT team: "Thanks a million!" Exchange: "No problem man. Email us with your new coins anytime."  It really does not work like that.

Author: votecoin.site
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: We tend to disagree. Listings on exchanges do not ensure whether the coin is alive or dead. Don't get us wrong, we would like VOT to be listed on as many exchanges as possible. We did our best to get VOT listed at several exchanges (small and big ones). But please understand that it is not our decision not to be listed, it relies solely on exchange decision which coin they list! Show us other coins that started from scratch, are 1 month old and already have listings on major exchanges.  For example look what happened to Bitcoinz. After listing on C-cex price went down from 150 sat to 11 sat. This shows, that listing on multiple exchanges will not help coin to grow. What will help to grow value of the coin is finished product which users will use. Once we have finished product, people will start using it, creating demand for VOT and this is the time when exchanges will start listing VOT. To be honest, without working product we seriously doubt any major exchange would list VOT.  And we are working hard to have our product (wallet with voting feature) finished as soon as possible.

Author: votecoin.site
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: It has been little over 2 weeks from the end of the ICO. We spent some time trying to get VOT to exchanges, some time recruiting more work force and now we have finally jumped on development. We collected only fraction of the necessary funds during ICO and we did NOT reach our milestone for GUI Wallet. But we want to continue on this project, since we are convinced that the idea of using VoteCoin for public voting, crowd funding and opinion surveys has big potential. Unfortunately due to lack in financing, things may go little bit slower.  We agree with your suggestions that our top priority should be VoteCoin GUI Wallet now.  There are several possible ways to go:  1) The Quick way - we can fork or extend some existing software, such as https://github.com/zencashio/eleos and release it as VOT Wallet. We're not willing to go this way, since such wallet brings no new features to VoteCoin. We prefer to focus on developing our own software. But if there is a community member who wants to try this, we will surely support that effort by providing links from our website to such fork.  2) The Satisfactory way - we can develop a solution to provide some sort of GUI on top of the text-mode wallet. Technically, you would still need to run the text-mode wallet as you do it now, and at the same time you would be able to access the most common features through your web browser, which would communicate with the textmode wallet. This way we could create appealing GUI wallet in a reasonable time, but this would be a bit uncomfortable and unprofessional. On the other hand, the code implemented for this solution could be mostly reused for our final GUI wallet too, so we may be able to do this within the next few weeks.  3) The Best way - we prefer to continue developing VoteCoin GUI wallet with all the features we want (especially the voting) in Electron, or similar multi-platform framework. Our dev team estimates that this will take few months to be completed and properly tested. We hope to provide such wallet in first quarter of 2018.

Author: votecoin.site
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: We have recently implemented changes of Zcash 1.0.12 which included bug fixes and usability improvements. Also a new RPC method z_shieldcoinbase was added as an experimental feature, for easily shielding coinbase UTXOs.  Release here: https://github.com/Tomas-M/VoteCoin/releases/tag/v1.0.12  Summary of the changes included in this release:  added z_shieldcoinbase as an experimental feature. changed the importprivkey RPC method to return the public address corresponding to the imported key. fixed build issues encountered when using GCC 7. added support for fetching the public network parameters from IPFS.  There are several files in this release. If you are a new user, download VoteCoin-v1.0.12-Win-All.zip. This file is around 800MB big and contains everything (VoteCoin textmode server, client, and zkSNARK proving keys).  If you upgrade from previous release, you can download VoteCoin-v1.0.12-Win-only-binaries.zip which contain only the executables votecoind.exe and votecoin-cli.exe. Shutdown any old version you may be using and replace these executables with newest versions.  If you are a Linux user, you can either download Linux binaries, or compile VoteCoin from sources. In all cases, make sure to backup your data before any operation, especially the wallet.dat file.

I think though the work and the results are not the same as the community expects, but still good enough. I will continue to watch how it goes.

Author: votecoin.site
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: well, most of the questions are about the exchanges and we gave answers many times already.  We really don't know what's wrong with Yobit listing. We check the site every day to see if they happen to list VOT, but still no sign of listing. We've opened ticket with Yobit support, still no answer from them. What can we do more?  We just have to wait.  Meanwhile, we've subitted VOT to all 4 exchanges boo50 suggested earlier in this thread. Other than that we've submitted to: Poloniex Bittrex HitBTC And some smaller exchanges.  We've submitted VOT to coinmarketcap.com too, but they probably list coins with trade volume bigger than $10k daily. We want VOT to be listed on exchanges, but it is not as easy as we thought it would be.  Someone mentioned Bitcoinz in this thread. They also forked Zcash, so basically it is same coin as VOT (except they have 21mld total supply of tokens), They've started about 1,5 months before us and they are still listed only on TradeSatoshi as well. They have no other active exchanges listings, check for yourself: https://coinmarketcap.com/currencies/bitcoinz/#markets  We feel the pressure from the community and we are doing everything we can. But replying to the same questions about exchanges all the time will not help us to get anywhere. We continue working on GUI Wallet, we updated the core client 3 days ago. But for listing on exchanges, we just have to wait.

Author: votecoin.site
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: You're right, we handled this really wrong. Community contribution is way to go. We learned that.  On the other hand, community mostly ask for listing on exchanges. We are open to suggestions and we will welcome any discussion about VOT future. But all we can see now are questions about Yobit and some blames and accusations .. we simply put them on ignore, because we know we did everything we could.  We want VOT to be community driven project. For example Boo50 is doing great job maintaining Slack, Discord and Telegram for VOT.

Author: ianj
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: Self-Sovereign Identity Panel             https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LCbjpEUyiUw Secure & Protect Identities                https://www.civic.com/ The Path to Self-Sovereign Identity    https://www.coindesk.com/path-self-sovereign-identity/ An Ethereum Voting Scheme ....        https://www.coindesk.com/voting-scheme-ethereum-doesnt-give-away-vote/  This stuff is soooo relevant .... and Andreas Antonopoulos  is awesome ..   This panel discusses the aspiration of Self-Sovereign Identity within our current systems of identity management - in social networks, hospitals, banks, government databases, or (sadly) the next data dump. Is our identifying information essential to our daily lives, or is it collected based on an unquestioned security theater that profiles and exploits the vulnerable? Can identity be automated, decentralized, secure, and global? Must we rely on third-party custodians to define who we are? Could we regain control of our selves?

Author: votecoin.site
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: Guys, I will address all your concerns in this one post, I'm sure everybody will find his answer here  It seems your biggest concern is listing on exchanges. We're doing our best to get listed VOT on as many exchanges as possible. We've submitted VOT to several exchanges, the bigger ones and smaller ones as well: Yobit.net - we've submitted on Oct 21. VOT is still not listed there. We contacted support and sill waiting for their answer. That's all we can do for now. HitBTC - as much as we'd like to have listed VOT there, their 15 BTC fee for 6 months listing seems ridiculously high to us. We're not going to pay such high fee. Anyway, we've submitted VOT there using their form hoping they will like VOT and list it for free. We are still waiting for their answer. Cryptopia - their current listing fee is 5.000.000 DOT - that equals to approx. 6 BTC now. It is too high for us. We'd rather pour that money into VOT development. We did our research and found out that cryptopia listed coins for as low as 400.000 DOT in the past. They simply have too many coin listing requests now, so they inflated their listing price. We monitor cryptopia and as soon as they lower their listing fee to reasonable level we will submit VOT immediately. NovaExchange - we've emailed them our submission, but before we heard back from them, they announced that they are closing their exchange. Tradesatoshi - dropping price really does not stress us that much. Only weak hands are selling at these low levels. At the time of writing this post there were 14.946.125 VOT in circulation. Only 230.000 VOT is offered for sale on TS below the ICO price. That is less that 2% of available coins. If the price on TS was such big concern for us, we would simply deposit 0.5 BTC to TS and drive the price up to 0.00000570 BTC easily. We do not have the need to manipulate the price.  We've strengthened our development team and after some research, the team agreed on using Electron (https://electron.atom.io/) for developing of our GUI wallet. Electron can be used to code multiplatform applications, so we should be able to release GUI wallet for all operating systems at once. Initial work has already started.  No one commits on github in the last month simply because VOT has finished and fully working code. We've implemented a few minor fixes or added parameters in the VOT core client recently. We're now testing those changes and if everything runs smoothly we will release it on GitHub as soon as possible.  There is also something cooking with Slax (https://www.slax.org/) and VOT. Slax was downloaded and used by millions. That is solid user base to start with. Stay tuned for some news soon.

Author: ianj
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: This is what is needed - some demonstration of interest or progress in the project. There is no point in developing in a silo whilst the world falls around you. Myself, i don't need lots of exchange listings - i was happy to hold and contribute, but your lack of communication is a serious problem. The lack of any progress on Yobit just felt like one more promise you disappointed on. Any small community contribution was just sniffed at whilst at the same time your concrete contributions have been zero. And before you point at the initial fork on github and whitepaper i think 29 BTC is barely nothing ...  The community get their reward from mining, yes; and that is ok if you just expect a dump; that is precisely what you will get. A miner makes a commitment in power and equipment for which they get rewarded. But you expect more; you expect the mining community to rise and carry the flag !! If you want to see that then get up and support and encourage ..  I myself contributed a quickly hacked up tool to fill a gap - your reply "it looks ugly" rather than "hey, great effort - but keep a look out for our (imagineware) its just so cool"  When you constantly put down those in the same community you alienate the community.  And as far as the community contribution is concerned - you are supposed to be the seed of that - so go and seed. Don't ignore us.  I don't need exchanges - i need some incentive to develop towards a concept i had high hopes for ..

Until network is so weak and centralised, pool hoppers can do what they want.

Author: votecoin.site
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: When you receive 2500 VOT, it is stored in your address as a message which says "address A sends 2500 to address B". When you spend some VOT from your address B, like 5 VOT, it has to spend the entire amount which was received into B, for that reason it spends the entire 2500 VOT, while 5 goes to your destination and the remaining amount minus fee goes to a newly generated address in your walled, lets call it address C, which is called Change address.  When you check balance at the time when the transaction is unconfirmed, you will see 2500 missing because the coins are already sent away from your wallet, but the remainder (2495) is not received yet back because it is not yet confirmed. After the  transaction is confirmed, which takes 2.5 minutes on average, but can take 20 minutes or even longer on bad luck, then your balance will show that you are missing only 5 VOT and the rest is back.  This is normal behavior and it applies to bitcoin as well.  Regarding yobit exchange, we paid for the listing and we wait for them to list VoteCoin, however it is their sole decision if they list it or not (and in all cases, they keep the money). We applied for listing on other exchanges too, it is not easy to get listed, it needs time.

Author: votecoin.site
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: Getting on an exchange is not a simple task. You cannot just send them email asking to add a coin. They will simply ignore your request. We have gone through the process of applying for several bigger exchanges, some of them even have really strange terms... And some others request high fee, like 15 BTC for 6 months listing, we're not going to accept that, we need the money for future development - newly implemented features are the most important factor for future price direction, and we all want VoteCoin to rise.  We've paid for premium listing on Yobit, but again that does not mean anything, they can simply decide to never list VoteCoin and they won't refund the fee. You see how strange this is... So we have to be patient.

Author: votecoin.site
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: If you're running your pool, please set your Hex identification so the block explorer could identify you. In z-nomp software,  you can edit transactions.js, find the line where z-nomp sets its hash, and change it to yours. To generate your hash, you can use this online tool: http://string-functions.com/string-hex.aspx Best format of your string is: YourPoolName http://yourPoolAddress.com/  When you're ready, send us PERSONAL MESSAGE through this forum with block ID of your newest mined block. It can be for example URL like this: http://explorer.votecoin.site/block/000000314e0d7ede4155bc8d138d3a38f8e56b289d516bc3eb8cf7343adcfef5  We will update our block explorer to list your pool (including hyperlink) on each block you mine. Thank you!

Author: votecoin.site
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: If there are 10 miners, the network finds 1 block every 150 seconds on average. If there are 1000 miners, the network also finds 1 block every 150 seconds on average. The amount of miners and the amount of their power actually doesn't matter for VoteCoin (or for any other coin in general).  And as I already mentioned, there is no way to find out who mined how much, there is no way to contact the miners, they were using many different pools, they were solo mining, their addresses may no longer be accessible, etc, etc. It is IMPOSSIBLE to pay any reward to miners even if we wanted to do so...

Author: votecoin.site
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: You know what I find funny? Tezos had huge ICO promotion and developers raised $232 mln. But still no gui wallet, no exchange listing till at least Feb 2018. Even investors are waiting several months to have their tokens distributed to them and on derivative markets Tezos futures already dropped about 75%. And investors can't do anything about it.  On the other hand, not so big VoteCoin promotion. VOT tokens are already being distributed to ICO participants. Hundreds of miners are already mining VOT - hash rate over 400 KSol/s . VoteCoin network is stable. Users can already send VOT transactions and can trade VOT on TradeSatoshi (yes, he added VOT by himself, we didn't even know such exchange existed). Yobit.net and coinexchange.io listing will hopefully follow soon.  I guess some Tezos investors now wish they invested in VOT instead of in Tezos

Author: votecoin.site
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: Last chance - receive up to 600% bonus from VoteCoin ICO!  There are only 2 days left until the end of VoteCoin ICO.  During our ICO campaign, which lasts for two months, we have already raised more than 28 BTC out of our total goal of 200 BTC. That means we sold around 1.4 million of VOT coins out of the total premined 10 million, so there are lots of unsold VOT coins at the moment. This is actually good news for all investors, and still a great opportunity for you.  The ICO ends on 21st of October 2017 at 10:00 CET.  At that time, we will calculate all unsold VOT coins, and those will be distributed among all participating investors as a bonus. The split will be proportional - that means, if your investment represents certain percentage of the total raised sum, you will receive the same percentage of the unsold coins.  The bonus will be paid to all participating investors, including those who invest in the next two days. So if you decide to invest now, you will get huge bonus too!  The total bonus will depend on the amount of unsold VOT coins at the end of ICO, as you can see in the following table:   So for example, if total amount of raised investments is 30 BTC, all participants will get 566% VOT bonus! As you can see, even if the total raised amount is 100 BTC, you still get 100% bonus VOT tokens.   So take your chance, join VoteCoin ICO now and --> GET UP TO 600% BONUS NOW <--

Author: votecoin.site
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: We always wanted to have a nice and useful GUI wallet. But we realized that our team is too small to develop such wallet. So we decided to premine some coins and sell them all using ICO to raise funds. The funds will be used to hire more developers, to make a GUI wallets and other stuff which we need. The more money we raise, the more developers we can hire, and the faster the development will be.  Quote 2) why dont you uncover your identities more? Developer is kinda tracable, but Mr. Josef Svoboda is really unknown person. Page of project contains some kid-style painted portraits that only looks suspicious. Also vague words of "owner of various internet businesses" is disaster. What should I imagine behind this? Like some scamy sites, if you are not ready to tell us?  The identity of project leader is clear. Tomas Matejicek is a public persona. Regarding other team members, they prefer to remain non-public. Imagine you are running an internet business of some sort which is completely legal, but may be considered NSFW (not safe for work). As an example consider porn industry, gambling industry, ... Just examples. It may be wiser not to connect this kind of business with VoteCoin project. ...  Quote 3) Why dont you have proper address? You use postal box, it also looks like you are more trying to hide behind something than being transparent Well, we decided to use postal box instead of accepting mail to any personal address. I'm not sure why this should be a problem, but I realize you may not like it.  Quote 4) Will I recieve any invoice if I invest into your ICO? Lets say I would like to send money from my company and I need some invoice for my accountant? If you need invoice, we can arrange that upon request.  Quote 5) What exactly makes your coin way more unique from Zcash? So far it only looks like fork of Zcash to me without any unique features. The differences are mentioned at votecoin website, that is: No founders reward, No slow start period, and Multiplatform nice GUI wallet (to be developed). We have also plans on integrating faster proving scheme for shielded transactions, but this will be implemented in zcash too. Other than that, there are no significant differencies between VoteCoin and ZCash and we never claimed or promissed any "way more unique" features.  Quote Hope you will answer my questions. If not, you area scam for me, because sorry.. ICOs today are 90% scams and leaders must be transparent and able to answer all questions. We realize that some ICOs are selling coins which will never exist at all. But VoteCoin CANNOT be scam, regardless of dev team or anything else, because it is ALREADY a WORKING COIN, you can mine it, you can send and receive VOT coins, and if you purchase VOT in the ICO, you will receive VOT of the promissed value, nobody ever complained here or anywhere else about that.  Hope this helps.

Author: blacklig
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: questions for devs here:  1) what for are you going to use money raised via ICO?  so far you have raised around 20 BTC which is not change and your target is 1 mil USD in todays price. Definitely not change for team of 2 people. I really would like your plan to be like - if we raise this, we get 2 more devs.. but you are only promising releasing of windows wallet etc.  2) why dont you uncover your identities more? Developer is kinda tracable, but Mr. Josef Svoboda is really unknown person. Page of project contains some kid-style painted portraits that only looks suspicious. Also vague words of "owner of various internet businesses" is disaster. What should I imagine behind this? Like some scamy sites, if you are not ready to tell us?  3) Why dont you have proper address? You use postal box, it also looks like you are more trying to hide behind something than being transparent  4) Will I recieve any invoice if I invest into your ICO? Lets say I would like to send money from my company and I need some invoice for my accountant?  5) What exactly makes your coin way more unique from Zcash? So far it only looks like fork of Zcash to me without any unique features.  Hope you will answer my questions. If not, you area scam for me, because sorry.. ICOs today are 90% scams and leaders must be transparent and able to answer all questions.

Author: CRAMS
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: Of course no one is saying they should be listed now, I'm just pointing out the major flaw in this approach. There is absolutely no benefit to applying to only 1 exchange. Polo barely lists any coins, might as well try with bittrex which lists a new coin almost every week (it seems like at least). At this rate VOT won't be listed on an exchange this year.  I'd love to hear what a dev has to say.

Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy

Body: Now block reward is 125 VOT. But when will the halving be?

Author: achkn
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: Code: CAmount GetBlockSubsidy(int nHeight, const Consensus::Params& consensusParams) {     CAmount nSubsidy = 125 * COIN;     if (nHeight==1) return COIN * 10000000;      int halvings = nHeight / consensusParams.nSubsidyHalvingInterval;      // Force block reward to zero when right shift is undefined.     if (halvings >= 64)         return 0;      // Subsidy is cut in half every 840,000 blocks which will occur approximately every 4 years.     nSubsidy >>= halvings;     return nSubsidy; } Code: consensus.nSubsidyHalvingInterval = 840000;  Every 840 000 blocks, ~4,050925925925926 years

Author: Adens
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: Well is the exclusively listing being discussed with Polo or did you guys just decided to only apply to be listed on Polo making it a Polo exclusive? Because if it's the second one that's just dumb, there's a chance that polo doesn't even list VOT because they hardly list coins in comparison to Bittrex.  The reason I'm asking is because there's two different posts on two different forums by the same person that says two different things. On a forum (I google translated from Russian to English) it said:   "Votecoin underwent full verification on Polonix and agreed on an exclusive listing on this exchange."  Who agreed on the exclusive listing?  Was that an agreement that was reached between VOT and Poloniex?  OR  Was it an agreement reached between the VOT team members?

Author: votecoin.site
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: I know anyone can get a fully verified account. We have one now. It is required by Poloniex to get listed on their exchange. On the other hand it does not guarantee anything. Now we just have to wait if they decide to list VOT.

Author: votecoin.site
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: We haven't discussed anything with Poloniex at all. We just submitted VOT using their form. There is no agreement between Poloniex and VoteCoin team.  For start we (VoteCoin team) agreed to submit exclusively to Poloniex as we think it give us better chance of getting listed. If Poloniex would not list VOT, we will submit to Bittrex and Kraken. If neither of these 3 big exchanges won't list VOT, we will continue with smaller ones.

Author: _javi_
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: Dev, your clarification was much needed.  Thanks for the answer.  Good luck!

Author: Adens
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: Why only Poloniex? I don't understand why you wouldn't take a shot at every exchange and see which one accepts you. Unless you have been in contact with Polo to let them know you only want to have VOT be listed on their exchange they won't know that so there's no benefit to only applying to them. Is there an actual reason you believe only applying to Polo will help VOT's chances of being listed? Polo and Bittrex are owned by two different entities so it's not like they share information between one another since they are competitors.

Author: votecoin.site
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: In the whitepaper, there is a section titled "future value estimation". It shows a table with other equihash coins, and their price. However there is actually nothing else at all. We do not claim that VoteCoin will have any value at all. We only claim, that we "assume", that VoteCoin will achieve "similar or better results". But of course thats only our assumption, and it is of course just made up, it's our best hope. I see nothing wrong with that.  I realize your concern, that since VoteCoin has 10 times more coins, then the value could be probably 10 times smaller per coin, but smaller than what? smaller than ZCASH? So $30 per coin instead of $300? It could be also 10 times higher if there is huge demand, you can never know that anyway ... It is always pure speculation.

Author: Nightz
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: I assume vote coin is not stable in price. Does that not conflict with the fact that votes should be as equal as possible? If someone wants to cast his or her vote and has to purchase a coin for that first, isn't it then likely that some will pay more than others just to able to cast a vote for a certain event? In politics I feel that would be really bad. When I think about a voting system on a blockchain that is also supposed to operate in public domains, the equality issue is one that comes straight up to my mind, especially since you have an ICO for those coins.

Author: _javi_
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: hey dev!  I wish you the best of luck with this project. In fact i´m investing on it   BUT i´ve read the whitepaper, and the "future value estimation" is quite WRONG imho  You cant compare token price just looking at algorithm. Other zerocoin implementations have different specs, that help define the price.  We have a block rewards of 125... while others have 12.. 10 or even 3. That change the daily emmited tokens so much!! and hence the price.  So you just cant compare. Its misleading.  Dont get me wrong.. i want VOT to be 3..10..or 300usd. Time will tell. But your estimation is quite off, and it shouldnt be included in the whitepaper.

Author: votecoin.site
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: A month passed since the release of VoteCoin and it is time for a little recap:  First month we were focusing all our resources mainly on developing software and VoteCoin network. Good news is that VoteCoin starts to gain momentum and more and more people (miners, investors, promoters) getting involved in the project. Seeing all these people taking interest in VOT opens good prospects for the future.  Here is summary of our accomplishments so far:  We have successfully released fully functional VoteCoin core client: https://github.com/Tomas-M/VoteCoin Now anyone can send and receive VoteCoins (VOT) We have successfully implemented Insight as a blockchain explorer web application service for VoteCoin: http://explorer.votecoin.site/ Now anyone can browse through all VOT transactions, see mined blocks and see with their own eyes that VoteCoin network is stable and everything runs smoothly. Anyone can check Genesis block -  where we mined 10.000.000 VOT for the ICO. All 10 million coins are now sitting at this address and we are ready to start distributing them to all investors. We have successfully opened official VOT mining pool with 0% fee: http://pool.votecoin.site/ Now anyone with some technical knowledge and decent hardware can mine VOT on his own. We are pleased to see that more and more miners are joining and mining VOT, which helps to secure VoteCoin network. We have released Official VoteCoin wallet for Windows (850MB): https://github.com/Tomas-M/VoteCoin/releases/download/v1.0.11-win32/VoteCoin.standalone.Win32.zip You asked for it and we delivered! Starting now everyone using Windows can setup VOT wallet and start receiving or sending VoteCoins. It is not GUI wallet yet, it is only a text-mode server and client. The big size is due to the proving key which is included in the release, to make it simple for users to download and use.  There is still a lot of work ahead of us, to name a few:  Our main goal is still the development of GUI wallet for Windows, Linux and MAC OS X. It is a hell of work, but we know it will be well worth it. The initial release should also include functionality for voting, crowd funding and much more. We watch closely the latest developments in elliptic-curve cryptography and we are eager to implement new proving scheme algorighms to VoteCoin, for example the elliptic curve called Jubjub (to be included in ZCash too) which is efficient to perform operations on inside of zk-SNARK circuits. Rough estimate indicates 80% reduction of proving time, and a 98% reduction in memory usage, which is simply awesome. We have started the enhanced account verification process on major exchanges Poloniex and Bittrex. This step is required to get VOT listed on these exchanges and as many of you know, this process can take long time.  We'd like to thank to all our supporters! For all those who already bought some VOT in the ICO or who simply like the VoteCoin idea, please spread a word about us and recommend us to other investors. And for all those who haven't invested yet, it is now right time to do so. Seeing all our prospects we think we're selling cheap now. Keep in mind that the ICO ends in less than a month. Have a nice day everybody!

Author: boo50
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: commands are the same, but people don't know how to work with command line.  here are a simple guide: 1) run votecoind.exe wait till full sync   2) create a .bat like ones for a miner and put in: for new address  Code: votecoin-cli getnewaddress pause  after you got address you can start mining, examples  Nvidia EWBF :loop miner --server votecoinmine.site --user your_wallet.worker --pass any --port 3333 --eexit 3 goto loop   AMD Claymore :loop ZECMiner64.exe -zpool stratum+tcp://votecoinmine.site:3333 -zwal yourwallet_.worker -zpsw pass goto loop   3) for balance check create .bat  Code: votecoin-cli getbalance pause  4) send transactions  Code: votecoin-cli sendtoaddress recieving_addr pause

Author: ianj
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: @votecoin.site - any more information on how the voting stuff might work, in addition to the stuff in your white paper  I have "skin in the game" so it is interesting to see what happens and maybe even to contribute something  Specifically, how will you : Model a vote subject/candidates in the block chain Do you have voter allocations or can anyone vote for anything What happens if you vote in excess of your allocation - does the size of your wallet decide everything ? How are voting subjects created/maintained - a central repository, an address How do you define a "fake" vote - for that you need to define a "legitimate" vote How will you track non transparent votes to ensure they are legitimate How will you implement proxy/delegated voting Interesting idea on combining voting with crowd funding - care to elucidate ?  Also, is there any room for community input or discussion on this ? And feel free to be technical - i have plenty more questions

Author: Yerba
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: Well, i try to make it short: 1) Dont run votecoin-cli. Run votecoind instead it ( this one is daemon ). 2) Dont run bat file. Bat file contains shortcuts for commands . Run just command prompt instead it. Navigate to VoteCoin standalone Win32 folder. I hope You know how to use cd .. and cd commands in command prompt. When You are in VoteCoin standalone Win32 folder then just type vot and press enter. You will see brief help for commands. With vot addr command You can generate new address. Remember - bat file contains just shortcuts for commands. With votecoin-cli getaddressesbyaccount "" command You will see all Your votecoin accounts. You can insert shortcut to this command into bat file also. For example: if "%1" == "accounts" (    votecoin-cli getaddressesbyaccount ""    goto exit ) Next time just type vot accounts and voila.

Author: achkn
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: Haha a long time i cant find how make transactions from votecoin-cli I find 6 hrs ago LOL https://github.com/Tomas-M/VoteCoin/blob/master/README.md $ ./src/votecoin-cli z_sendmany FROM_ADDR '[{"address": "TO_ADDR", "amount": 123}]' 1 0 In the above mentioned example, both FROM_ADDR and TO_ADDR can be either T addresses or Z addresses or combination. The last two numbers (1 0) stand for minConf and fee. In the example above, the coins on FROM_ADDR must have at least 1 confirmation, and fee is set to zero.  Remember that coinbase transaction (sending newly mined coins) must be done from a T address to a Z address. So if you wish to send newly mined coins to a T address, you need to send them to a Z address first and then make another transaction from that Z address to the T address destination.  After a transaction is executed using z_sendmany, you can check its status by using:  $ ./src/votecoin-cli z_getoperationresult Thanks for this. Very useful information.

Author: votecoin.site
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: VoteCoin (VOT)  Website: https://votecoin.site White Paper: https://votecoin.site/VoteCoin-Whitepaper.pdf GitHub: https://github.com/Tomas-M/VoteCoin  VoteCoin Mission VoteCoin is a decentralized anonymous platform for elections and other voting purposes, based on Zerocoin protocol. It can simplify public polls, surveys and crowd funding campaigns and create their process more flexible and easily trackable. This new digital currency can strengthen democracy and help people to reach their goals.  VoteCoin Use Cases Staked Polls - Weighted voting by transferring value, either public or anonymous Decision Funding - Traceable coins can be limited and distributed by the organizer of the poll/election to obtain fair voice of the voters. Public Elections - Shielded transactions hide the sender, recipient, and value on the blockchain while keeping the count decentralized and verifiable by any participant. Crowd Funding - Raising contributions for a project or venture, targeted to particular features Sports Betting - Decentralized platform that changes the way the world bets on sports     Staked Polls By Using VoteCoin GUI Wallet you can create secure voting polls that deliver unprecedented trust through the integrity of blockchain technology. A vote cast to the blockchain is unforgeable and the voting results recorded on it are indisputable. Results can never be altered, and identities of participants are protected.  Start by clicking VOTE button in GUI Wallet, then "+Add poll or campaign". Setup your poll by filling a title and options. Add a logo and chose your poll behaviour.     Get your poll id to your users and let them vote. Check poll results and earn some extra VOT!    2018 Roadmap 2018 Q1 - Graphical wallet for Windows Linux and Mac, with support for voting - DONE 2018 Q2 - Reputation system for poll publishers 2018 Q2 - Poll Explorer - users will be able to go through directory of created polls and participate. 2018 Q3 - Addition of Decision Funding, Public Elections and Crowd Funding features to the GUI Wallet 2018 Q4 - Anonymous voting support  Wallets Official VoteCoin GUI Wallet: https://github.com/Tomas-M/VoteCoin-wallet/releases/ VoteCoin core client: https://github.com/Tomas-M/VoteCoin Official VoteCoin wallet for Windows (850MB): https://github.com/Tomas-M/VoteCoin/releases/ The big size is due to the proving key which is included in the release, to make it simple for users to download and use. Ian’s java wallet: https://github.com/ianpjohnson/votecoin-swing-wallet-ui/releases/tag/0.68.6.votecoin Makalone’s wallet: https://drive.google.com/file/d/0BzoG9JwbaxccSW5KZzk5V0tCeTA/view?usp=sharing Danis Ahmaev's wallet: https://github.com/danis-ahmaev/votecoin-swing-wallet-ui  Blockcahin Explorers Insight blockchain explorer: http://explorer.votecoin.site/  Mining Pools Nibiru Pool: http://nibirupool.com LuckPool: https://luckpool.net/votecoin/ Zsolo: https://zsolo.bid/ CatsPool: http://votecoin.catspool.org/ Cryptomena http://znomp.cryptomena.io/ MultiPool: https://multipool.es PCMiNing: http://pcmining.xyz:8080 Abakus Pool: http://www.abakus.gemini.net.pl/ EQ Pool: http://www.eqpool.com Owl Mining Club Pool: http://owlminingclub.com Mining Speed: https://pool.miningspeed.com Lucky Mining: https://vot.lucky-mining.com.ua/ Aika Pool: https://aikapool.com/vot/ MinePool.HU: https://zmine.minepool.hu/ ZeroPool: http://zeropool.io SysPool: http://syspool.org Block Smasher: http://blocksmasher.org Pear Pool: http://votecoin.pearpool.com HuiBit China: http://pool.whibbit.cn/ Miner Maniac: http://www.minermaniac.com/ Delta Pool: http://votecoin.deltapool.net/ Digital 49er's: http://pool.digital49er.com Crypto Mining Pool: https://vot.crypto-mining-pool.com/ EZ Pool: http://ezpool.ga/ Miners Pool: https://votecoin.minerspool.cc/ Raptor Pool: http://vot.raptorpool.org/  Exchanges TradeSatoshi: https://tradesatoshi.com/Exchange?market=VOT_BTC Crex24i: https://crex24.com/exchange/VOT-BTC Digital Price: https://digitalprice.io/ Cratex: https://cratex.io/  Community Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/votecoin/ Twitter: https://twitter.com/vote_coin Slack: link Discord: https://discord.gg/Xbz2egM Telegram: https://t.me/vote_coin Reddit: someone please make reddit  Useful Links VOT hashing power and difficulty: https://www.crypto-coinz.net Standalone VoteCoin mining thread: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=2167614.0 Make a wallet and start mining VOT (tutorial by Marks Crypto from miningspeed.com): https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zd10SbX6XW4   If you know about some resource which is not listed here, please PM us details and we will list it here!    VoteCoin technical specifications  Name: VoteCoin Ticker: VOT Total supply: 220.000.000 VOT Block reward: 125 VOT Block size: 2MB Block time: 2,5 minutes Proof Type: POW (proof of work) Hashing algorithm: equihash   Why Equihash? We are big fans of decentralisation and equihash is memory-oriented Proof-of-Work algorithm (your mining power is mostly determined by size of your RAM). So Equihash is resistant to ASIC mining.  We have ZCash. Why should we choose VoteCoin? Yes, VoteCoin source code is based on the peer-reviewed ZCash sources and follows the same trusted setup provided by the Zcash team. Offers a high standard of privacy and preserves the confidentiality of transactions through sophisticated zero-knowledge proving scheme.  Furthermore, VoteCoin provides three main advantages:  No Founders Reward: Zcash implements Founders Reward, where 20% of coins are transferred to the Zcash developers and investors during the first years. We have removed this “feature”, so VoteCoin has no founders reward. No Slow start period: Zcash implements Slow start period, where mining produces fractional reward to miners on start, and the reward slowly increases afterwards. We have removed this from VoteCoin, so miners get their full reward from the very beginning. Multi-platform wallet: Zcash is officially supported only as a Linux text-mode client.  We provide an easy to use Graphical Wallet Application for all major operating systems, including Linux, Windows, and MAC OS.      There is still a lot of work ahead of us. We watch closely the latest developments in elliptic-curve cryptography and we are eager to implement new proving scheme algorighms to VoteCoin, for example the elliptic curve called Jubjub (to be included in ZCash too) which is efficient to perform operations on inside of zk-SNARK circuits. Rough estimate indicates 80% reduction of proving time, and a 98% reduction in memory usage, which is simply awesome.   --> CHECK VOTECOIN WEBSITE <--

Author: eur
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: "Your purchase will be assigned to email address"...  After I send my BTC, how do I get tokens VOT, will they come to my mailbox? If you do not collect the right amount, will the project be closed? Where will the coin be traded, exchanges?  please reply, thank you.

Author: votecoin.site
Title: [ANN][VOT]: VoteCoin - a new era of anonymous crypto democracy
Body: Your purchase will by assigned to email address just in our system.  Once your bitcoin payment is confirmed and manually verified, we will contact you and negotiate best way to send you your new VOT coins.  There are two possibilities:  1. You download and install the Linux client (link: GitHub) and create a T address, we can send your VOT coins to it right away.  2. You will wait until VoteCoin is listed at some exchange, then you may be able to receive your VOT coins to the address given by the exchange, no need to install the client at all.  It also answers your last question, we'll do our best to get VOT listed at exchanges.
